get.summary: Property search by address, city, state, zip code and apn
get.description:
This API returns a list of properties that match the given search criteria.

To search for Properties by address, one of the following minimum search criteria must be specified:
  • {streetAddress, city, state}
  • {streetAddress, zipCode}
To search for Properties by Assessor Parcel Number (APN), one of the following minimum search criteria must be specified:
  • {apn, state, county}
  • {apn, zipCode}
  • {apn, countyCode}
Best Match: Addresses may match to more than one property. When true is provided for bestMatch, a single, best matched property is returned. When false is provided for bestMatch, all matched properties are returned. This is an optional field and if left blank, defaults to 'false'.

It is recommended that you provide as many attributes as possible to improve the accuracy of the results.

parameters.name: bestMatch
parameters.description: true/false, true is required for bestMatch only, default is false

get.summary: Property search by Address or APN or Owner
get.description:
This API returns a list of properties that match the given search criteria.

To search for Properties by address, one of the following minimum search criteria must be specified:
  • {streetAddress, city, state}
  • {streetAddress, zipCode}
To search for Properties by Assessor Parcel Number (APN), one of the following minimum search criteria must be specified:
  • {apn, state, county}
  • {apn, zipCode}
  • {apn, countyCode}
To search for Properties by address and Owner, the following minimum search criteria must be specified:
  • {streetAddress, city, state, Name (format below)}
  • {streetAddress, zipCode, Name (format below)}
  • Full name: LastName FirstName MiddleInitial (no punctuations) recommended Partial name: LastName or FirstName
It is recommended that you provide as many attributes as possible to improve the accuracy of the results.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Supports up to two owners (separated by a comma) using the following formats: By full name: LastName FirstName MiddleInitial (Example: Smith John A, Jones Brenda P) By last name: LastName (Example: Smith, Jones) By combo of full name and last name or reverse: (Example1: Smith John A, Jones or Example2: Smith, Jones Brenda P)

get.description: Climate Risk Analytics AR6 API delivers comprehensive parcel-level climate risk metrics across multiple Shared Socioeconomic Pathways (SSPs) to provide both current and future projections for climate risk impact. This includes individual hazard impacts along with Composite Risk Scores with financial impacts.

parameters.name: clip
parameters.description: CoreLogic Unique identification number assigned to each property.

get.description: Climate Risk Analytics AR5 Comprehensive delivers property climate risk metrics including Composite Risk Score (CRS), scaled 1-100 representing the total risk to a property from all hazards, Average Annual Loss (AAL) per year and peril and Probable Maximum Loss (PML) outputs across multiple (50/100/250/500 year) time horizons, for approximately 140 million parcels across the U.S.  CoreLogic's physical risk model combines our proprietary datasets and models into a comprehensive single score that incorporates the following hazards: Earthquake, Wildfire, Inland Flood, Severe Convective Storm, Winter Storm, Hurricane/Tropical Storm Surge and Hurricane/Tropical Storm Wind.  Additionally, Representative Concentration Pathways (2.6, 4.5, and 8.5) prescribed by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) model out forecasted hazard changes for the current year and years 2030, 2040 and 2050.  These metrics incorporate IPCC scenarios overlaid with CoreLogic's proprietary suite of hazard risk data & analytics and catastrophe models.  The result is climate risk metrics for each RCP scenario, down to the individual property level.  These economic measures are used in insurance markets, in the housing ecosystem and by financial services prudential regulators for supervisory stress testing and oversight.  The measures are also used by government agencies planning and maintaining infrastructure programs and by corporations.

Current Mortgage API provides a view of current open mortgages for a given subject property. Transactions include Primary/Junior mortgages & Purchase/Refi/Helocs. Details include borrower names, lender details with NMLS IDs, type of loan secured (e.g., conventional, FHA, VA), mortgage rate type, mortgage purpose (cash out first, consolidation, standalone subordinate, etc.), mortgage ARM features and mortgage indicators such as fixed rate, conforming loan, construction loan, private party and other indicators.

Involuntary Liens API provides a broad look into the status of non-Voluntary Liens related to a subject property (CLIP). Below are the liens included in this product.

Property HOA Liens: HOA Liens are placed against a property by the Homeowners Association for unpaid HOA dues.
Property Mechanics Liens: Mechanic's Liens are placed against a property by Service Companies for unpaid service fees.
Property Tax Liens: Tax liens are placed against property by Taxing Authority for unpaid property taxes.

Mortgage History API provides nationwide property mortgage data for up to 50 years. Transactions include Primary/Junior mortgages & Purchase/Refi/Helocs. Details include borrower names, lender details with NMLS IDs, type of loan secured (e.g., conventional, FHA, VA), mortgage rate type, mortgage purpose (cash out first, consolidation, standalone subordinate, etc.), mortgage ARM features and mortgage indicators such as fixed rate, conforming loan, construction loan, private party and other indicators.

Includes up to 4 owners, owner addresses and other owner details on over 152 million residential and non-residential properties.

get.summary: Property Detail query for multiple blocks and products.
get.description: Nationwide, comprehensive property data for over 152 million parcels is available with Property from CoreLogic. This product delivers a robust set of property records which includes parcel and subdivision information, geospatial data, property owner and owner mailing details, property value and tax information including tax assessment, tax amount and tax exemption indicators and an extensive set of property characteristics that describe the property's structure attributes. The data also includes the most recent purchase transaction information including sale recording date, sale amount, seller name and more. Please note, Property Detail report is a composite report that comprises of 6 other individual reports Buildings, Last Market Sale, Most Recent Owner Transfer, Ownership,Site-Location and Tax Assessments.

Document Images API V2 provides direct access to retrieve document images for a variety of property-related document types. These images are recorded at the county-level and include real property records, also known as 'official records.' Images include hundreds of recorded document types including deeds, mortgages, liens, releases, assignments, transfers, etc.

To search for Documents, the following minimum search criteria must be specified:

  • {Recorded Document Images Product}
  • {Fips Code}
  • {Recording Date}
  • {Document Number}
Additionally, one or more of the following optional search criteria to filter the result set can be specified:

  • {Secondary Document Number}
  • {Document Type}
  • {Output Type}
It is recommended that you provide as many attributes as possible to improve the accuracy of the results.

parameters.name: fipsCode
parameters.description: 5 digits; first two identify State, next three identify County

parameters.name: recordingDate
parameters.description: Provide full date as YYYYMMDD or year as YYYY

parameters.name: outputType
parameters.description: PDF | TIFF (default is PDF if not specified)

get.description: Rent Amount Model_v2 provides property level detail on modeled Estimated Rental Value of a property, which includes both Rental High Value and Rental Low Value, a Forecasted Standard Deviation Score and CAP Rate based on the model value. Rent Amount Model is used by Investors to evaluate potential properties for Rental Income.
Property location endpoints including legal, location and neighborhood, property use codes, property lot size and utilities on over 152 million residential and non-residential.

Solar and PACE Liens API provides a broad look into the status of Solar contracts and PACE Liens related to a subject property (CLIP). Property-related Solar and PACE Liens against a property from services provided to the property.

Collected from the county Tax Assessor by CoreLogic, full Tax Roll county refreshes can be updated as frequently as twice a year by county. CoreLogic maintains Tax Roll data for 99.9% of counties nationwide.

Transaction History v2.0 API: Transaction History delivers Owner Transfer History and Mortgage History in a single API along with the mortgage coverage summary for the county.  Owner Transfer delivers buyer, seller, and transfer details on property transactions for sales and ownership transfers covering up to 50 years of sales history. Transactions include the individual change of ownership from both arms-length and non-arms-length transactions including cash, quitclaims, trust transfers, etc. with or without a mortgage(s). Mortgage History API provides nationwide property mortgage data for up to 50 years. Transactions include Primary/Junior mortgages & Purchase/Refi/Helocs. Details include borrower names, lender details with NMLS IDs, type of loan secured (e.g., conventional, FHA, VA), mortgage rate type, mortgage purpose (cash out first, consolidation, standalone subordinate, etc.), mortgage ARM features and mortgage indicators such as fixed rate, conforming loan, construction loan, private party and other indicators.

propertyTypeCode.description: A CoreLogic general code used to easily recognize specific property types (e.g. Single Family Residence, Condominium, Commercial). This value was determined from property information upon receipt of the transaction and reflects the Property Indicator as a static value at that point in time.

landUseCode.description: A CoreLogic established Land Use code converted from various county Land Use codes to aid in search and extract functions. This value was captured from property information upon receipt of the transaction and reflects the Land Use as a static value at that point in time.

stateLandUseDescription.description: State-specific secondary Land Use provide by the county.Â  This value was captured from property information upon receipt of the transaction and reflects the State Land Use Description as a static value at that point in time.

countyLandUseDescription.description: Primary (e.g. highest) Land Use as established by the county or local taxing administration.Â  This value was captured from property information upon receipt of the transaction and reflects the County Use Description as a static value at that point in time.

zoningCode.description: The data contained in this field is based upon County and/or Local established Zoning Codes and is not converted by CoreLogic.

zoningCodeDescription.description: County provided zoning code description that describes the allowable land use for the real property.

isManufacturedHome.description: This field is populated with a "Y" if a Manufactured Home is present on the parcel.

LandUseAndZoningCodes.description: Land Use And Zoning Codes Details

careOfName.description: Care of Name for mail delivery.

streetAddress.description: Full mail address (not including City/St/Zip) (e.g. 123 N Main St). This also contains unparsed foreign mailing address.

city.description: The city associated with the mailing address.

state.description: The two-letter USPS postal abbreviation associated with the state / protectorates / commonwealth (e.g., CA, VI, PR).

zipCode.description: Code assigned by the USPS. This is populated by various source files and other proprietary and non-proprietary processes. Data may be the 5-digit zip or 9-digit Zip+4 (e.g., 00501 or 954630042).

carrierRoute.description: This is the four digit code used by the local mail carrier to identify the delivery path.

messageType.description: Based on the clip data messageType will give the information about messageType is Success or Error.

message.description: Based on the clip data message will give the information about whether data is found or not found

firstMortgageDate.description: Recording date of the earliest mortgage record available in the database for the County.

lastMortgageDate.description: Recording date of the most recent mortgage record available in the database for the County.

firstReleaseDate.description: Recording date of the first release of mortgage record available in the database for the County.

lastReleaseDate.description: Recording date of the most recent release of mortgage available in the database for the County.

standardizedCounty.description: CoreLogic standardized county name associated with the property address.

standardizedState.description: CoreLogic standardized two-letter state postal abbreviation. (e.g. CA, TX)

titleCompanyName.description: This is the Title Company associated with the sales transaction.

titleCompanyCode.description: This is a CoreLogic internal code used to identify the Title Company that was associated with the sales transaction.

mortgageCompositeTransactionId.description: Unique transaction key comprised of FIPS Code, Transaction Batch Date, Transaction Sequence Number, and Mortgage Sequence Number.

mortgageChronologyNumber.description: CoreLogic derived number that identifies the parcel's chronology of mortgage transactions. The first 8 characters of the ChronoNbr is the date portion of the number.

conformingLoanIndicator.description: CoreLogic standardized value that indicates if the mortgage loan is considered a conforming loan. Values: 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

equityLoanIndicator.description: CoreLogic standardized value that indicates if the mortgage loan is an equity loan. Values: 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

nonconformingLoanIndicator.description: CoreLogic standardized value that indicates if the mortgage loan is a non-conforming loan. Values: 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

otherSubordinateLoanIndicator.description: CoreLogic standardized value that indicates if the mortgage loan is a subordinate lien. Values: 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

concurrentJuniorMortgageIndicator.description: Identifies a junior mortgage that is recorded simultaneous/concurrent/at the same time as the senior mortgage on the property.

silentSecondMortgageIndicator.description: Identifies a junior mortgage where Seller is also the Lender.

mortgageUpsellIndicator.description: Identifies a junior mortgage where Lender is an institution and is the same Lender as the senior mortgage.

sellerCarryBackIndicator.description: CoreLogic standardized value that indicates if part or all of the mortgage loan is carried by the seller. Values: 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

gseEligibleMortgageIndicator.description: Indicates if a Government Sponsored Enterprise entity (GSE) Mortgage Rider was recorded with the mortgage loan. Values: 0 or null = not applicable, 1 = applicable.

loanOfficerNMLSId.description: Typically this field will contain First Deed of Trust (Purchase or Refinance) - Lender's NMLS ID.  This field may be NULL or Zero if loan is not required by the S.A.F.E. act to be recorded with NMLS information such as Equity line/loan.

loanOfficerNMLSName.description: Typically this field will contain First Deed of Trust (Purchase or Refinance) - Lender Officer's NMLS Name.  This field may be NULL or Zero if loan is not required by the S.A.F.E. act to be recorded with NMLS information such as Equity line/loan.

loanCompanyNMLSId1.description: Typically this field will contain First Deed of Trust (Purchase or Refinance) - NMLS ID associated with the Loan Origination.  This field may be NULL or Zero if loan is not required by the S.A.F.E. act to be recorded with NMLS information such as Equity line/loan.

loanCompanyNMLSName1.description: Typically this field will contain First Deed of Trust (Purchase or Refinance) - Lender's NMLS Name. This field may be NULL or Zero if loan is not required by the S.A.F.E. act to be recorded with NMLS information such as Equity line/loan.

loanCompanyNMLSId2.description: Typically this field will contain First Deed of Trust (Purchase or Refinance) - NMLS ID associated with the Loan Origination, if a second ID is listed on document.  A second NMLS ID may be listed on the mortgage document.  For example, a Loan Broker NMLS ID may be listed on the document in addition to the Lender NMLS ID.  This field may be NULL or Zero if loan is not required by the S.A.F.E. act to be recorded with NMLS information such as Equity line/loan.

loanCompanyNMLSName2.description: Typically this field will contain First Deed of Trust (Purchase or Refinance) - Lender's NMLS Name.  This field may be NULL or Zero if loan is not required by the S.A.F.E. act to be recorded with NMLS information such as Equity line/loan.

ownerTransferCompositeTransactionId.description: Unique transaction key comprised of FIPS Code, Transaction Batch Date, Transaction Sequence Number, and '000'.  FIPS Code + Transaction Batch Date + Transaction Sequence Number can be used to match up with Mortgage Composite Transaction ID.

OwnershipTransfers.description: Owner Transfer delivers buyer, seller, and transfer details on property transactions for sales and ownership transfers covering up to 50 years of sales history. Transactions include the individual change of ownership from both arms-length and non-arms-length transactions and includes all sales transactions including cash, quitclaims, trust transfers, etc. with or without a mortgage(s).

actualYearBuilt.description: This is the construction year of the original building on the parcel as provided by the county.  Not all counties maintain both Original and Effective Year Built. Null if not available from the source. Format: YYYY

effectiveYearBuilt.description: Typically this field reflects the first year the building was assessed with its current components (e.g., a building is originally constructed in 1960 and a bedroom and bath was added to the building in 1974. In this example, Year Built would be 1960 and the Effective Year Built would be 1974).   Certain counties only maintain one Year Built data element, and overlay Original Year Built with Effective Year Built if there was a structural change to the building that affected Assessed Value.  In these counties, Year Built will be null and Effective Year Built will contain the single data element provided by the source - examples include Fresno and San Diego counties.  Format: YYYY

isResidentialProperty.description: Indicates whether the property is residential. Y = yes or NULL = no or unknown.

isNewConstruction.description: CoreLogic standardized value that indicates the ownership transfer/sale is for a newly constructed property - usually the seller is the Builder and identified from information on Grant Deed.   0 = not applicable, 1= applicable.

streetAddress.description: Full Situs address (not including City/St/Zip) (e.g. 123 N Main St)

city.description: The city associated with the property address.

state.description: The two-letter USPS postal abbreviation associated with the state / protectorates / commonwealth (e.g., CA, VI).

zipCode.description: Code assigned by the USPS. This is populated by various source files and other proprietary and non-proprietary processes. Data may be the 5-digit zip or 9-digit Zip+4 (e.g., 00501 or 954630042).

carrierRoute.description: This is the four digit code used by the local mail carrier to identify the delivery path.

sequenceNumber.description: If there are multiple sellers, the sequenceNumber begins with 1 for the first seller and increases by one for each additional property seller.

fullName.description: CoreLogic standardized full seller name who is listed on the deed for the most recent sale transaction.

houseNumber.description: The digits found to the left of a street name.

houseNumberSuffix.description: The characters found to the immediate right of a house number (e.g., 202B Jones Rd).

houseNumber2.description: The second set of numbers in an address range.

direction.description: This field represents the direction found to the left of the street name (e.g., 9340 N Dunhill Dr). AKA Directional Abbreviations, Pre-Directional.

streetName.description: The name or number of the street where a parcel is located.

mode.description: The Mode or Type of street found to the right of the street name (e.g., 9340 N Dunhill Dr). AKA Street Designators / Street Suffixes.

quadrant.description: The quadrant is found to the right of Situs Mode (e.g., 2040 NW 100 ST SW). AKA Post-Directional.

unitNumber.description: The unit or suite number of the mailing address (e.g., 649 Lake Shore Dr 1400).

subjectTransactionRecordingDate.description: Recording Date of the subject transaction associated with this event. Format = YYYYMMDD.  Document sourced, refers to prior associated transaction.  Typically refers back to the Recording Date of the Deed of Trust/Mortgage.

subjectTransactionDocumentNumber.description: Document Number of the subject transaction associated with this event.  Document sourced, refers to prior associated transaction.  Typically refers back to the Document Number of the Deed of Trust/Mortgage.

subjectTransactionDocumentBookNumber.description: Document Book Number of the subject transaction associated with this event.  Document sourced, refers to prior associated transaction.  Typically refers back to the Document Book Number of the Deed of Trust/Mortgage.

subjectTransactionDocumentPageNumber.description: Document Page Number of the subject transaction associated with this event.  Document sourced, refers to prior associated transaction.  Typically refers back to the Document Page Number of the Deed of Trust/Mortgage.

name.description: This is the Title Company associated with the sales transaction.

code.description: This is a CoreLogic internal code used to identify the Title Company that was associated with the sales transaction.

etalCode.description: A code appearing in this field indicates additional ownership, whose name(s) were not provided by our sources.  Values are: A = ET AL - AND OTHERS, C = ET CON - AND HUSBAND, U = ET UX - AND WIFE, V = ET VIR - AND HUSBAND.

ownershipRightsCode.description: CoreLogic standardized code that indicates the type of vesting for current borrower or borrowers.

ownershipRightsCodeDescription.description: CoreLogic standardized description that indicates the type of vesting for current borrower or borrowers.

relationshipTypeCode.description: CoreLogic standardized code that identifies the relationship status of the current borrowers.  Used with Borrower Relationship Type Code Description element.

relationshipTypeCodeDescription.description: CoreLogic standardized description that identifies the relationship status of the current borrowers.  Defines the code found in Borrower Relationship Type Code element.

sequenceId.description: If there are multiple borrowers, the sequenceNumber begins with 1 for the first borrower and increases by one for each additional property buyer.

borrowerFullName.description: Full Name of the BORROWER at the time of the transaction.

borrowerFirstName.description: First Name of the BORROWER at the time of the transaction.

borrowerMiddleInitial.description: Middle Initial of the BORROWER at the time of the transaction.

borrowerLastName.description: Last name of the BORROWER at the time of the transaction.

borrowerCorporateIndicator.description: Indicator that the BORROWER has been recognized as a corporation or business.

relationshipTypeCode.description: Relationship between multiple owners or marital status.

etalCode.description:
A code appearing in this field indicates additional ownership, whose name(s) were not provided by our sources. Values are:
A = ET AL - AND OTHERS
C = ET CON - AND HUSBAND
U = ET UX - AND WIFE
V = ET VIR - AND HUSBAND.

occupancyCode.description: CoreLogic derived code that indicates if the property buyer intends to reside  at the situs (property site). Values of M, O, and S indicate buyer occupied (A and T reflect absentee buyers).

ownershipRightsCode.description: Form or method of property ownership (e.g., Joint Tenants, Living Trust).

ownershipRightsCodeDescription.description: CoreLogic standardized description that indicates the type of vesting for current borrower or borrowers.).

hasPartialInterest.description: An indicator showing the Owner/Buyer has a partial interest in the property.

mailingOptOutIndicator.description: A "Y" represents a record where buyer has contacted the DMA (i.e., Direct Marketing Association) and has asked not to be contacted by mail for solicitation.

sequenceNumber.description: If there are multiple buyers, the sequenceNumber begins with 1 for the first buyer and increases by one for each additional property buyer.

fullName.description: Full name of the buyer at the time of transfer.

firstNameAndMiddleInitial.description: First Name and Middle Initial of the buyer.

isCorporate.description: Indicator that the buyer has been recognized as a corporation or business.

clip.description: CoreLogic Unique identification number assigned to each property.

primaryCategoryCode.description: CoreLogic proprietary transaction classification code that identifies the type of transaction.

deedCategoryCode.description: CoreLogic proprietary deed category type code that identifies the class of recorded legal document.

saleDateDerived.description: CoreLogic proprietary sale date derived from the original public record filing, representing the date that the Deed was prepared in advance of being notarized and prior to being recorded. Format: YYYYMMDD.

saleRecordingDateDerived.description: CoreLogic proprietary sale recording date derived from the original public record filing, representing the date the sales transaction was recorded at the county. This date is generally considered the transfer of ownership date. Format: YYYYMMDD.

saleAmount.description: Dollar amount of the most recent sale of the property.

saleTypeCode.description: This field indicates what the financial consideration is - if a Deed record represents a change of ownership (Sale).

saleDocumentTypeCode.description: The type of deed used to record the sales transaction (e.g., Grant, Quit, Foreclosure).

saleDocumentNumber.description: The document number used by some counties to record sales transactions - typically a Grant or Warranty Deed.

saleBookNumber.description: The Book number used by some counties to catalog their sales recordings.

salePageNumber.description: The Page number used by some counties to catalog their sales recordings.

ownershipTransferPercent.description: A percentile showing the percentage of ownership transferred.

multiOrSplitParcelCode.description: CoreLogic standardized code that identifies which parcel is being referenced in a multiple or split parcel sale. Values: EMPTY/NULL = Not applicable, M = First parcel of a multiple parcel transaction, D = Subsequent parcel of a multiple parcel transaction, S = Single parcel transaction where parcel is annotated as a portion of or with other property, Z = Multiple parcel transaction where parcel is annotated as a portion of or with other property.

isCashPurchase.description: CoreLogic proprietary value that identifies if the property was a cash-based arms-length transaction. 0 = not applicable, 1= applicable.

isMortgagePurchase.description: CoreLogic proprietary value that identifies if the property has a mortgage.0 = not applicable, 1= applicable.

isInterfamilyRelated.description: CoreLogic proprietary value that indicates if a potential relationship between the seller and the buyer of the property exists. This could be interfamily, intercompany, or trust transfer (non-arms length transaction).0 = not applicable, 1= applicable.

isInvestorPurchase.description: CoreLogic proprietary value that indicates if the buyer bought the property for investment purposes. 0 = not applicable, 1= applicable.

isResale.description: CoreLogic standardized value that indicates whether the transaction is considered a resale of an existing property. 0 = not applicable, 1= applicable.

isShortSale.description: CoreLogic proprietary indicator that identifies if the property sale is considered a short sale.  0 = not applicable, 1= applicable.

isForeclosureReo.description: CoreLogic proprietary value that indicates whether the transaction was a completed foreclosure where the bank took back ownership of the property (REO).  0 = not applicable, 1= applicable.

isForeclosureReoSale.description: CoreLogic proprietary value that indicates that the bank sold the REO to a third party. 0 = not applicable, 1= applicable.

ownershipTransfers.description: Owner Transfer delivers buyer, seller, and transfer details on property transactions for sales and ownership transfers covering up to 50 years of sales history. Transactions include the individual change of ownership from both arms-length and non-arms-length transactions and includes all sales transactions including cash, quitclaims, trust transfers, etc. with or without a mortgage(s).

mortgageHistory.description: Includes up to 4 owners, owner addresses and other owner details on over 152 million residential and non-residential properties.

lenderCompanyCode.description: CoreLogic standardized lender code that identifies the mortgage lender (e.g., Bank of America = 000003).

lenderCompanyName.description: CoreLogic proprietary and standardized name of lender from CoreLogic proprietary Lender Code table.

lenderFullName.description: Full name of Lender as recorded on the original document when no CoreLogic Lender Company Code exists.

lenderLastName.description: Name of Lender's Last Name as recorded on the original document when Lender is a Private Party.

lenderFirstName.description: Name of Lender's First Name as recorded on the original document when Lender is a Private Party.

lenderAddress.description: Address of the Lender as recorded on the original document.

lenderCity.description: Lender City as recorded on the original document.

lenderState.description: Lender State as recorded on the original document.

lenderZipCode.description: Lender ZIP code as recorded on the original document.

lenderPostToCode.description: Standardized grouped Lender Code when 2 or more Lender Name variations exist or when CoreLogic aggregates smaller lenders into a single group (Ex. 000252.)

lenderPostToName.description: Corresponding Lender Name that correlates with Lender Post-To Code. (Ex. 000252 matches to Other Institution Lenders.)

initialResetDate.description: CoreLogic derived interest rate change date for an adjustable mortgage. First interest rate reset date. Format: YYYYMMDD.

changeInterval.description: Identifies the number of intervals for interest rate changes for an adjustable mortgage. Numeric value in conjunction with MORTGAGE ARM FREQUENCY.

frequency.description: Indicates the measurement of time in relation to the interest rate reset/change of the adjustable mortgage. Values: W = Weekly; M = Monthly; Q = Quarterly; Y = Yearly.

calculationChange.description: Percentage points added to the Index rate to calculate the new interest rate. Value added to current index to determine new interest rate. Only for adjustable rate mortgages.

maximumInterestRate.description: Maximum interest rate allowed per the life of the loan. Lifetime interest rate maximum. Only for adjustable rate mortgages.

indexType.description:
Indicates which index is used to determine the adjustable mortgage interest rate.
Value Description
SOF    SOFR
LIB    LIBOR
CMT    Constant Maturity Treasury
MTA    Monthly Treasury Average
LAM    LAMA
PRM    Prime
DIS    11th District
BIL    Treasury Bill
FNM    FNMA (Fannie Mae)
OTH    Other

changePercentLimit.description: Maximum amount the interest rate may increase or decrease for any one adjustment period of the adjustable mortgage. Limit on interest rate change for any single adjustment.

initialChangeMaxPercent.description: Maximum interest rate the adjustable mortgage loan rate can increase from the initial interest rate as per the recorded loan documents. Maximum allowable interest rate indicated on initial reset.

lookbackPeriod.description: The number of days back from interest rate change date to acquire index value.

paymentChangeDate.description: Date of payment change (if different than interest rate change date). Format: YYYYMMDD.

payOptionIndicator.description: CoreLogic standardized flag that indicates if the mortgage loan has payment options such as interest only, interest and principal or interest and principal with a lump sum. '0 or null = Not Applicable, 1 = Applicable'.

interestOnlyIndicator.description: CoreLogic standardized flag that indicates the mortgage loan is an interest only payment loan. '0 or null = Not Applicable, 1 = Applicable'.

negativeAmortizationIndicator.description: CoreLogic standardized flag that indicates if the mortgage loan has a negative amortization clause. '0 or null = Not Applicable, 1 = Applicable'.

prepaymentRiderIndicator.description: CoreLogic standardized value that indicates if the mortgage loan contains a prepayment rider. 'Y' = Prepayment Rider present.

categoryCode.description: CoreLogic internal code that identifies the type of Adjustable Rate Mortgage (ARM) loan. Values: NULL = Not Applicable, A = Alternative, H = Hybrid, O = Other, S = Subprime, R = Reverse

TransactionHistoryMortgageDetail.description: Includes up to 4 owners, owner addresses and other owner details on over 152 million residential and non-residential properties.

plannedUnitDevelopmentRiderIndicator.description: Indicates if a Planned Unit Development (PUD) Rider was recorded with the mortgage loan. 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

multifamilyRiderIndicator.description: Indicates if a Multifamily Rider was recorded with the mortgage loan. 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

condominiumRiderIndicator.description: Indicates if a Condominium Rider was recorded with the mortgage loan. 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

secondHomeRiderIndicator.description: Indicates if a  Second Home Rider was recorded with the mortgage loan. 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

variableRiderIndicator.description: CoreLogic standardized value that indicates if the mortgage loan contains an adjustable or variable rate rider. 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

multiOrSplitParcelCode.description: CoreLogic standardized code that identifies which parcel is being referenced in a multiple or split parcel sale. Values: EMPTY/NULL = Not applicable, M = First parcel of a multiple parcel transaction, D = Subsequent parcel of a multiple parcel transaction, S = Single parcel transaction where parcel is annotated as a portion of or with other property, Z = Multiple parcel transaction where parcel is annotated as a portion of or with other property.

primaryCategoryCode.description: CoreLogic proprietary transaction classification code that identifies the type of transaction.

deedCategoryCode.description: CoreLogic proprietary deed category type code that identifies the class of recorded legal document.

amount.description: The amount of the mortgage at the time of the transaction.

date.description: Borrower's signature date on mortgage/deed of trust.  This represents the date the borrower's obligation to the lender begins, i.e. loan open date.  This date is the same or prior to the recording date. If the day and/or month is missing, CoreLogic populates these values with 00. Format: YYYYMMDD.

recordingDate.description: The date the mortgage transaction was recorded at the county.  Format: YYYYMMDD.

interestRateTypeCode.description: CoreLogic standardized value indicating the type of mortgage interest rate. Values: NULL = Unknown, ADJ = Adjustable, BAL = Balloon, FIX = Fixed

interestRate.description: Beginning interest rate per the recorded loan documents for Adjustable Rate Mortgage and the fixed interest rate for all other mortgage records.

loanTypeCode.description: Type of loan secured (e.g., Conventional, FHA, VA).

documentTypeCode.description: Type of deed used for recording (e.g., Mortgage, Loan Modification Agreement, Deed of Trust).

documentNumber.description: The document number used by some counties to record mortgage transactions.

documentBookNumber.description: The Book number used by some counties to catalog their mortgage recordings.

documentPageNumber.description: The Page number used by some counties to catalog their mortgage recordings.

termCode.description: Code used to identify whether the number stored in MORTGAGE TERM is in days, months or years.

term.description: Specific time period that identifies the mortgage due or maturity term. Corresponds with the MORTGAGE TERM CODE field.

dueDate.description: The date the mortgage becomes due. If the day and/or month is missing, CoreLogic populates these values with '00'.  Format: YYYYMMDD.  May be derived.

mortgageTypeCode.description: CoreLogic standardized mortgage classification for principal mortgages ('P'urchase, 'R'efinance) or subordinate mortgages ('J'unior).

purposeCode.description: CoreLogic standardized value indicating the reason for the principal or subordinate mortgage. Values: A = Cash out first, B = Rate/Term reduction, C = Piggy-back on purchase, D = Standalone subordinate, E = First with subordinate, F = New first mortgage, K = Consolidation, L = Undetermined first mortgage, M = Undetermined standalone subordinate, N = Piggy-back on refinance, O = HUD reverse mortgage, P = First trust modification, Q = Junior trust modification, V = Reverse mortgage

subordinateTypeCode.description: CoreLogic standardized value indicating the type of subordinate mortgage secured. (e.g., 'C'redit Line, 'E'quity, Ba'L'loon)

subordinateTypeCodeDescription.description: CoreLogic standardized description indicating the type of subordinate mortgage secured. (e.g. Credit Line, Equity, Balloon).  Described value of subordinateTypeCodeDescription.

downPayment.description: Cash down amount at time of purchase (Available in limited geographies only).

lienPosition.description: The order a mortgage is in lien prioirty for all open mortgages.

statusIndicator.description: Corelogic standardized value indicating if a mortgage is currently open, closed by event, in pre-foreclosure, or foreclosed. Values: R = Mortgage Released, P = Mortgage Paid Off, O = Open Mortgage, U = Foreclosed On, F = Pre-Foreclosure Filed, Null = Undetermined

releaseDate.description: Recording date of the mortgage Release/Reconveyance. Format: YYYYMMDD

payoffType.description: Corelogic standardized value that indicates the type of event used to determine mortgage was paid in full. Values: A = Subsequent arm length sale, B = Subsequent non-arm length sale that is classified to pay off mortgage, C = Paid off by a consolidation, modification and extension agreement (DocTyp = "CE", New York only), E = Non-construction balloon mortgage that expired, F = Subsequent purchase or refinance mortgage, H = Release for the mortgage was recorded, Null = Not paid off

payoffDate.description: Date of the event that paid off the mortgage in full.  The event can be a release/reconveyance (hard-close), or can be derived from logic to determine mortgage was paid in full. Format: YYYYMMDD

principalTitle.description: Title of first signatory on Mortgage or Deed of Trust.

principalNameSuffix.description: Name suffix associated with the first signatory on the Mortgage/Deed of Trust.

principalFullName.description: Full name of first signatory or Company Name on the Mortgage or Deed of Trust.

principalFirstName.description: First name of first signatory on the Mortgage/Deed of Trust.

principalMiddleInitial.description: Middle Name of first signatory on the Mortgage/Deed of Trust.

principalLastName.description: Last name of first signatory on the Mortgage/Deed of Trust.

taxAssessedYear.description: The assessment year for which the taxes were billed.

calculatedTotalValue.description: The "TOTAL" (i.e., Land + Improvement) Value closest to current market value used for assessment by county or local taxing authorities.

calculatedLandValue.description: The "LAND" Value closest to current market value used for assessment by county or local taxing authorities.

calculatedImprovementValue.description: The "IMPROVEMENT" Value closest to current market value used for assessment by county or local taxing authorities.

calculatedImprovementValuePercentage.description: The "IMPROVEMENT" percentage indicates the percentage of assessed value allocated to improvements.

calculatedTotalValueSourceCode.description: The code appearing in this indicator field reflects the type of values used to seed the TOTAL VALUE CALCULATED field (i.e., A = Assessed, M = Market, P = Appraised, T = Transitional).

taxableValue.description: Assessed value less exemptions. Value on which property taxes are based.

taxableImprovementValue.description: County provided value of the improvement applied to the parcel used in the calculation of the tax bill.

taxableLandValue.description: County provided land value of a parcel used in the calculation of the tax bill.

taxableOtherValue.description: County provided land value of fixture, features or miscellaneous values used in the calculation of the tax bill.

code.description: District or entity responsible for administration of community colleges.

name.description: Community college district name responsible for administration of community colleges.

code.description: District or entity responsible for administration of elementary schools.

name.description: Name of the district or entity responsible for administration of elementary schools.

code.description: County provided code which represents the county-designated area where parcels share a common fire district and fire houses.

name.description: County provided name which represents the county-designated area where parcels share a common fire district and fire houses.

code.description: High School or Secondary School District in which the property is located.

name.description: Name of the High School or Secondary School District in which the property is located.

clip.description: Unique identification number assigned to each property.

code.description: Code of the county-designated area where parcels share a common lightning district for the specific function of acquiring insurance.

name.description: Name of the county-designated area where parcels share a common lightning district for the specific function of acquiring insurance.

code.description: District or entity responsible for administration of middle schools.

name.description: Name of the district or entity responsible for administration of middle schools.

code.description: Name of district or entity responsible for administration of public schools.

name.description: Tax or assessment exemption associated with a school or other educational facility.

code.description: County-provided code for an area where parcels share a common county designated sewer management authority.

name.description: County-provided name for an area where parcels share a common county designated sewer management authority.

code.description: Identifies the county provided tax district code associated with a parcel.

name.description: Name of the district or entity responsible for appraising property for property tax purposes.

billedYear.description: The tax year for which the taxes were billed.

delinquentYear.description: County provided year the delinquent property taxes were due. Format: YYYY

areaCode.description: CoreLogic standardized code that identifies the tax area associated with the parcel.

areaCodeDescription.description: The corresponding description for the CoreLogic standardized code that identifies the tax area associated with the parcel.

propertyTaxRate.description: County provided tax rate for the property based on Property Taxes billed through the county..

totalTaxExemptionAmount.description: County provided value of buildings and land that are exempt from taxes on the parcel.

totalTaxAmount.description: Total billed property tax amount for the current tax year.

countyTaxAmount.description: Property tax levied by an individual county. Used in counties with multiple taxing jurisdictions reporting separately. (Ex: a parcel may be subject to a County Tax, City Tax, and School District Tax)

schoolTaxAmount.description: Property tax levied by a school district. Used in counties with multiple taxing jurisdictions reporting separately.

villageTaxAmount.description: Property tax levied by a village. (Village is an administrative division within a town or township.)

netTaxAmount.description: Property tax amount less exemptions and/or credits.

commercial.description: Returns applicable exemptions from the following list: AGRICULTURE, CHARITY, GOVERNMENT, RELIGIOUS, EDUCATION, UTILITY

items.description: Returns applicable exemptions from the following list: AGRICULTURE, CHARITY, GOVERNMENT, RELIGIOUS, EDUCATION, UTILITY

residential.description: Returns applicable exemptions from the following list: DISABLED, HOMESTEAD, MISCELLANEOUS, SENIOR, VETERAN, WIDOW

items.description: Returns applicable exemptions from the following list: DISABLED, HOMESTEAD, MISCELLANEOUS, SENIOR, VETERAN, WIDOW

lastAssessorUpdateDate.description: Date which CoreLogic applied a full tax roll for a county (independent of Assessed Year and Tax Year). Format: YYYY-MM-DD.

taxrollCertificationDate.description: Assessor certified date of the full county refresh date for the county. Typically occurs first of month. Format: YYYY-MM-DD.

code.description: County provided code for an area where parcels share a common county designated trash management authority.

name.description: County name for an area where parcels share a common county designated trash management authority.

code.description: County-designated code that identifies the utility management authority assigned to the parcel.

name.description: County-designated name that identifies the utility management authority assigned to the parcel.

code.description: Code that identifies the water management authority assigned to the parcel.

name.description: Name that identifies the water management authority assigned to the parcel.

code.description: Core Based Statistical Area code as designated by U.S. Office of Management and Budget.

type.description: Type of CBSA identified, either Metropolitan or Micropolitan Area. Reserved for later use.

id.description: Comprised of Census Tract, Census Block Group, Census Block, and Census Block Suffix. These numbers are established by the US Department of Commerce (Bureau Of The Census).

lat.description: CoreLogic derived geographic coordinate that specifies the north-south position of a point based on United States Postal Service address data for the parcel. The latitude contains numeric data values only conforming to the mask XX.ZZZZZZ, where the XX are the digits to the left of the decimal point, and ZZZZZZ are the digits to the right of the decimal point. Latitude is always a positive value north on the North American continent.

lng.description: CoreLogic derived geographic coordinate that specifies the east-west position of a point based on United States Postal Service address data for the parcel. The longitude contains numeric data values only conforming to the mask -XXX.ZZZZZZ, where the XXX are the numeric digits to the left of the decimal point, and ZZZZZZ are the 6 numeric digits to the right of the decimal point. Longitude is negative on the North American continent.

lat.description: CoreLogic proprietary parcel-centroid coordinate that specifies the north-south position of the center point of a parcel. The latitude contains numeric data values only conforming to the mask XX.ZZZZZZ, where the XX are the digits to the left of the decimal point, and ZZZZZZ are the digits to the right of the decimal point. Latitude is always a positive value north on the North American continent.

lng.description: CoreLogic proprietary parcel-centroid coordinate that specifies the east-west position of the center point of a parcel. The longitude contains numeric data values only conforming to the mask -XXX.ZZZZZZ, where the XXX are the numeric digits to the left of the decimal point, and ZZZZZZ are the 6 numeric digits to the right of the decimal point. Longitude is negative on the North American continent.

code.description: Some counties interchange or use this instead of municipality codes.

subdivisionName.description: The name of the Subdivision or Condominium where the parcel is located (e.g., Highland Mills Estates, Crystal Towers Condo).

subdivisionTractNumber.description: The unique number assigned to a specific subdivision by the county. Often this is used in lieu of an actual subdivision name.

subdivisionPlatBookNumber.description: The first component of a recording system used by some counties to catalog subdivision / condo plans (e.g., Book 123 Page 55A).

subdivisionPlatPageNumber.description: The second component of a recording system used by some counties to catalog subdivision / condo plans (e.g., Book 123 Page 55A).

blockNumber.description: Identifies the county block number where the parcel is located. Part of a subdivision or tract legal description. Subdivisions are often broken down into blocks, which are then broken down into lots.

blockNumberSuffix.description: Identifies the county block number suffix where the parcel is located.

lotNumber.description: Subdivision or County Map Lot Number. Part of a subdivision or tract legal description. Subdivisions are often broken down into blocks, which are then broken down into lots.

lotNumberSuffix.description: Subdivision or County Map Lot Number Suffix.

description.description: County or local jurisdiction legal property descriptions. This description provides additional information regarding the property. It primarily delineates the exact boundaries of the property and may include other values like mineral rights, description of the layout of the property, etc.

range.description: The "range" portion of geographical coordinates based on local surveys. Ranges typically run east or west of pre-determined "meridian" in six mile intervals.

township.description: The "township" portion of geographical coordinates based on local surveys. Townships typically run north or south of pre-determined "meridian" in six mile intervals.

section.description: The "section" portion of geographical coordinates based on local surveys. Sections are 1 square mile and there are 36 sections within the intersection of a Range / Township.

quarterSection.description: A section that has been divided into four "sub" sections (e.g., NE, NW, SE, SW).

areaAcres.description: CoreLogic derived or county provided value that indicates the total acreage of the parcel.

areaSquareFeet.description: Total land mass in square feet.

areaSquareFeetUsable.description: Area of lot in square feet suitable for building construction.

depthFeet.description: The linear feet between the front and back of the lot.

frontFeet.description: The linear feet across the front of the lot - facing the street.

shapeCode.description: County provided code or text describing the shape of a lot. Example: IRR = Irregular

topographyType.description: CoreLogic standardized code that identifies the topography of the property.

easementTypeCode.description: County provided code describing easement(s) that may exist on the property. Note: An easement is a right granted to one party with regard to the land of another party. Most easements provide for access across one property to another. This can also be a green space or waterways between two properties or county or city property such as city gas lines running across a property. Example: 2 = Flood Control Easement. Easement value is delivered if available, otherwise easement code is delivered.

code.description: Code supplied by the county or vendor that indicates the city, town or village in which the parcel is located.

name.description: Name of the Municipality where parcel is located.

code.description: County-specified code that identifies the specific neighborhood in which a property is located. Example: Crestview Heights in Autauga AL = CRES000.

clip.description: Corelogic Unique identification number assigned to each property.

name.description: Identifies the municipality (city) tax district associated with a parcel.

code.description: County provided tax rate area code associated with the parcel.
Some counties interchange or use this instead of municipality codes.

fuelTypeCode.description: Description of the type of fuel used for heating to the parcel. (e.g., Solar, Gas, Oil).

electricityWiringTypeCode.description: Description of the type of electricity and/or type of wiring within the building (e.g., Average Wiring, Underground Wired, Private Source).

sewerTypeCode.description: Type of sewer system on the parcel (e.g., Public, Septic, Commercial).

utilitiesTypeCode.description: Description of the type of utilities used in a building (e.g., Electric, Oil, Private).

waterTypeCode.description: Description of the type of water service on the parcel (e.g., Public, Well, Cistern).

typeCode.description: The type of air conditioning method used to cool the building (e.g., Central, Wall Unit, Evaporative).

buildingsCount.description: Total number of buildings on the parcel.

unitsCount.description: Number of residential, apartment or business units.

roomsCount.description: Total number of rooms as supplied by the source.

bedroomsCount.description: CoreLogic calculated total bedrooms for all the buildings on the property.

bathroomsCount.description: Total number of rooms that are considered bathrooms across all buildings on the property. For example, a half bathroom is considered one room.

fullBathroomsCount.description: Total number of full bath rooms as supplied by source. If source does not break out full versus partial Baths -field will be null in this case.

halfBathroomsCount.description: Total number of half bath rooms (typically comprised of a sink & toilet) as supplied by source. If source does not break out full versus partial Baths - field will be null in this case.

oneQtrBathroomsCount.description: Total number of quarter bath rooms (typically comprised only of a sink, as found in many laundry rooms) as supplied by source. If source does not break out full versus partial Baths - field will be null in this case.

threeQtrBathroomsCount.description: Total number of three-quarter bath rooms (typically comprised of a sink, toilet & shower stall) as supplied by source. If source does not break out full versus partial Baths - field will be null in this case.

bathroomFixturesCount.description: CoreLogic calculated total designated bath fixtures associated with all the bathrooms in all the buildings on the property. Examples: sink, toilet, shower stall, tub and faucets.

fireplacesCount.description: This represents the number of fireplace openings located within the building.

livingAreaSquareFeet.description: This is the area of all buildings that are used for general living. This is typically the area of all buildings that is heated or air conditioned and generally does not include Garage, Porch or Unfinished Basement Square Footage values.

totalAreaSquareFeet.description: CoreLogic calculated total square footage allocated to all square footage for all buildings on the property.

openAreasSquareFeet.description: CoreLogic calculated total square footage allocated to all open areas for the property.

officeSpaceSquareFeet.description: CoreLogic calculated total office area square footage in all the buildings on the property.

elevatorsCount.description: CoreLogic calculated total number of elevators for all the buildings on the property. This is mostly in use for commercial buildings.

loadingDocksCount.description: CoreLogic calculated total of loading docks for all the buildings on the property. This is mostly in use for commercial buildings.

railSpursCount.description: CoreLogic calculated total of rail spurs for all the buildings on the property. This is mostly in use for commercial buildings.

truckDoorsCount.description: CoreLogic calculated total number of truck doors for all the buildings on the property. This is mostly in use for commercial buildings.

typeCode.description: CoreLogic standardized code that identifies the attic type associated with the building. Example: LFT = loft.

finishTypeCode.description: The standardized code that identifies the basement's degree of completion.

count.description: The total number of bathroom fixtures (typically a full bath would have 4 fixtures - 1 = sink, 1 = toilet, 1 = bathtub, 1 = shower head).

clip.description: Unique identification number assigned to each property.

relationshipTypeCode.description: Relationship between multiple owners or marital status.

etalCode.description:
A code appearing in this field indicates additional ownership, whose name(s) were not provided by our sources. Values are:
A = ET AL - AND OTHERS
C = ET CON - AND HUSBAND
U = ET UX - AND WIFE
V = ET VIR - AND HUSBAND.

occupancyCode.description: CoreLogic derived code that indicates if the property buyer intends to reside  at the situs (property site). Values of M, O, and S indicate buyer occupied (A and T reflect absentee buyers).

ownershipRightsCode.description: Form or method of property ownership (e.g., Joint Tenants, Living Trust).

hasPartialInterest.description: An indicator showing the Owner/Buyer has a partial interest in the property.

mailingOptOutIndicator.description: A "Y" represents a record where buyer has contacted the DMA (i.e., Direct Marketing Association) and has asked not to be contacted by mail for solicitation.

sequenceNumber.description: If there are multiple buyers, the sequenceNumber begins with 1 for the first buyer and increases by one for each additional property buyer.

fullName.description: Full name of the buyer at the time of transfer.

firstNameAndMiddleInitial.description: First Name and Middle Initial of the buyer.

isCorporate.description: Indicator that the buyer has been recognized as a corporation or business.

typeCode.description: CoreLogic standardized code that identifies the type of ceiling in the building. Example: BBD = bead board.

heightFeet.description: County provided height in feet of the ceiling in the building.

yearBuilt.description: This is the construction year of the original building.

effectiveYearBuilt.description: This is the first year the building was assessed with its current components (e.g., a building is originally constructed in 1960 and a bedroom and bath was added to the building in 1974. The Year Built would be 1960 and the Effective Year Built would be 1974).

buildingStyleTypeCode.description: Type of building style (e.g., Colonial, Cape Code, Bungalow).

buildingQualityTypeCode.description: Type of construction quality of building (e.g., excellent, economical).

frameTypeCode.description: The type of wall framing used (e.g., Bar Joist, Reinforced Concrete, Flexicore).

foundationTypeCode.description: The type of foundation (e.g., Continuous Footing, Pier, Mud Sill).

constructionTypeCode.description: The primary method of construction (e.g., Steel / Glass, Concrete Block, Log).

buildingRemodelTypeCode.description: County provided code describing the nature of the remodeling that was applied to the building. During remodeling the outside walls are not changed and only internal walls, floors, ceilings and finishing's are redone.

buildingImprovementConditionCode.description: This represents the physical condition of the main improvement (e.g., Good, Fair, Under Construction).

buildingImprovementTypeCode.description: The primary improvement type (e.g., Grain Silo, Hanger, Marina).

buildingImprovementValue.description: Value of building improvement. Value is based on county-assessed, market or appraised improvement value as provided by the county.

ownerMailingOptOutIndicator.description: A "Y" represents a record where the property owner has contacted the DMA (i.e., Direct Marketing Association) and has asked not to be contacted by mail for solicitation.

relationshipTypeCode.description: CoreLogic derived code that indicates Relationship between multiple owners or the marital status of a single owner (e.g., Husband/Wife, Unmarried Man).

ownerEtalCode.description: A code appearing in this field indicates additional ownership, whose name(s) were not provided by our sources. Values are: A = ET AL - AND OTHERS C = ET CON - AND HUSBAND U = ET UX - AND WIFE V = ET VIR - AND HUSBAND.

occupancyCode.description: CoreLogic derived code that indicates if the property owner resides at the situs (property site). Values of M, O, and S indicate owner occupied (A and T reflect absentee owners).

ownershipRightsCode.description: CoreLogic derived code that indicates form or method of property ownership (e.g., Joint Tenants, Living Trust).

count.description: County provided number of dormer windows that rise above the roof line of a sloping roof for the building. Populated mostly in Maryland and Virginia.

typeCode.description: The type of fireplace. If more than one fireplace, this field reflects the first/main building.

count.description: Number of fireplace openings within the building.

typeCode.description: The type of floor construction (e.g., Concrete, Plywood).

coverTypeCode.description: CoreLogic standardized description for the type of floor covering within the building.

typeCode.description: Type or method of heating (e.g., Hot Water, Heat Pump, Baseboard, Radiant).

universalBuildingAreaSquareFeet.description: The Building Square Footage that reflects the most accurate available for use in assessments or comparables (e.g., Living, Adjusted, Gross).

universalBuildingAreaSquareFeetSourceCod.description: The codes appearing in this field indicates the source used to populate the UNIVERSAL BUILDING SQUARE FEET field. A=ADJUSTED, B=TOTAL, D=GROUND FLOOR, G=GROSS, L=LIVING, M=BASE/MAIN

buildingAreaSquareFeet.description: The size of the building in square feet. This field is most commonly populated as an aggregate total when a county does not differentiate between living and non-living areas.

buildingAdjustedAreaSquareFeet.description: This is the square footage used by the county or local taxing / assessment authority to determine Improvement Value. This figure is typically 100% of the living area, plus lower percentage of non-living area.

buildingGrossAreaSquareFeet.description: This is the square footage for the entire building. Typically this represents all square feet under the roof.

livingAreaSquareFeet.description: This is the area of a building that is used for general living. This is typically the area of a building that is heated or air conditioned and generally does not include Garage, Porch or Unfinished Basement Square Footage values.

aboveGradeAreaSquareFeet.description: Square footage (sq. ft.) of above ground line or grade of the earth for listed property.

groundFloorAreaSquareFeet.description: Square footage of the part of the building which is level with the ground (typically the front of the building). This is generally above the basement(s) and below the second floor.

basementAreaSquareFeet.description: This is the total square footage associated with the Basement portion of a building. This would include both finished and unfinished areas.

finishedBasementAreaSquareFeet.description: Square footage of below grade area improved for occupancy.

unfinishedBasementAreaSquareFeet.description: Square footage of below grade area not improved for occupancy.

aboveGroundFloorAreaSquareFeet.description: Square footage (sq. ft.) of above ground line or grade of the earth for listed property.

buildingAdditionsAreaSquareFeet.description: Total square footage for the additions to a building.

entryLevelFloorAreaSquareFeet.description: Total square footage for the entry level in the building.

secondFloorAreaSquareFeet.description: Square footage of building level immediately above ground floor.

thirdFloorAreaSquareFeet.description: Total square footage for the third floor in the building.

totalCount.description: Total number of rooms as supplied by the source.

bedroomsCount.description: CoreLogic calculated total bedrooms for the buildings.

bathroomsCount.description: Total number of rooms that are Bathrooms if this is the method of establishing bathroom property characterized by the source. Source values are whole numbers, although field allows for up to 2 decimal places in data deliveries.

fullBathroomsCount.description: Total number of full bath rooms as supplied by source. If source does not break out full versus partial Baths -field will be null in this case.

halfBathroomsCount.description: Total number of half bath rooms (typically comprised of a sink & toilet) as supplied by source. If source does not break out full versus partial Baths - field will be null in this case.

oneQtrBathroomsCount.description: Total number of quarter bath rooms (typically comprised only of a sink, as found in many laundry rooms) as supplied by source. If source does not break out full versus partial Baths - field will be null in this case.

threeQtrBathroomsCount.description: Total number of three-quarter bath rooms (typically comprised of a sink, toilet & shower stall) as supplied by source. If source does not break out full versus partial Baths - field will be null in this case.

kitchensCount.description: Total number of kitchens contained in the primary building.

familyRoomsCount.description: Total number of family rooms contained in the primary building.

livingRoomsCount.description: Total number of living rooms contained in the primary building.

basementRoomsCount.description: County provided total rooms located in the basement. Most jurisdictions count any room with a door, with the exception of bathrooms.

careOfName.description: CoreLogic standardized and parsed name for the person receiving mail on behalf of the owner.

streetAddress.description: Full mail address (not including City/St/Zip) (e.g. 123 N Main St). This also contains unparsed foreign mailing address.

city.description: The city associated with the mailing address.

state.description: The two-letter USPS postal abbreviation associated with the state / protectorates / commonwealth (e.g., CA, VI).

zipCode.description: Code assigned by the USPS. This is populated by various source files and other proprietary and non-proprietary processes. Data may be the 5-digit zip or 9-digit Zip+4 (e.g., 00501 or 954630042).

carrierRoute.description: This is the four digit code used by the local mail carrier to identify the delivery path.

foreignAddress.description: CoreLogic foreign delivery address for the owner.

firstNameAndMiddleInitial.description: First name and middle initial of property owner.

middleName.description: Middle name or initial of property owner.

isCorporate.description: Indicator that the property owner has been recognized as a corporation or business.

clip.description: Unique identification number assigned to each property.
Corelogic Unique identification number assigned to each property.

typeCode.description: Type of parking found for the structure. This is typically commercial or communal in nature (e.g., Condos).

garageTypeCode.description: Type of garage or carport present (e.g., Attached Finished, Enclosed Carport, Basement Garage).

parkingSpacesCount.description: This represents the total number of parking spaces or car capacity associated with the garage or parking type.

primaryAreaSquareFeet.description: This is the total square footage of the primary garage or parking area.

secondAreaSquareFeet.description: Total square footage for second Garage/Parking on the property.

carportAreaSquareFeet.description: Total square footage for primary carport on the property.

count.description: County provided total elevators in the building designated to transport passengers. Mostly used in commercial, multi-purpose, and multi-family buildings.
County provided number indicating how many patio areas the building includes.

typeCode.description: CoreLogic standardized code that indicates the type of patio present in the building. Usually adjoining the building and can be constructed of concrete, cement, stone, brick pavers or a combination. Typically does not have a roof covering. Example: 10B = brick patio.

areaSquareFeet.description: Total square footage for the primary patio or deck on the property.

typeCode.description: CoreLogic standardized code that indicates the type of plumbing present in the building. Example: PST = standard.
Type of pool, construction or pool amenities (e.g., Kidney, Gunite, Vinyl, Jacuzzi, Heated).

areaSquareFeet.description: Total square footage for the pool on the property.

count.description: County provided number indicating how many porches the building includes.

typeCode.description: CoreLogic standardized code that indicates the type of porch present in the building. Usually an extension of the building. Can be constructed of wood and built with a roof to cover the porch area. Porches usually have attached stairs (steps) leading to a walkway or path. Example: B00 = slab.

areaSquareFeet.description: Total square footage for the primary porch on the property.

secondPorchAreaSquareFeet.description: Total square footage for the second porch on the property.

typeCode.description: Type of roof (e.g., Gambrel, Gable, Flat, Mansard).

coverTypeCode.description: Type of roof covering (e.g., Clay Tile, Aluminum, Shake).

buildingTypeCode.description: The primary building type (e.g., Bowling Alley, Supermarket).

buildingClassCode.description: Standard Fire Insurance Building Classification codes: (A - Fireproof Steel, B - Reinforced Concrete, C- Concrete, D- Wood or Steel Frame, S - Incombustible). These are specific codes that we directly capture and are not derived from other data.

gradeTypeCode.description: County provided code for the grading of the property. Generally the grade description is an overall category of quality and the broad classification used is fair, average or very good.

fireSprinklerTypeCode.description: CoreLogic standardized code that identifies the type of sprinkler system associated with the building. This is most commonly used in commercial buildings.

fireInsuranceTypeCode.description: County provided code that identifies the type of building classification for fire insurance purposes. Mostly used for commercial or multi-family buildings. Values: A = Fireproof Steel; B = Reinforced Concrete; C = Concrete; D = Wood or Steel Frame; S = Incombustible

widthFeet.description: Measurement in linear feet of a specific side of a building. Generally refers to side of building facing street.

depthFeet.description: Measurement in linear feet of a specific side of a building. Generally refers to side perpendicular to that facing street.

sequenceNumber.description: This internal sequence number is used to ensure uniqueness of the Building Key.

compositeBuildingLinkageKey.description: Unique building key. This is a fixed-width field, with the APN component padded with blanks out to 45 characters within the composite key.

buildingName.description: County provided name for the building. Prevalent in commercial or multi-family buildings.

buildingNumber.description: County provided number of the building that uniquely identifies the building from others on the same parcel.

buildingSectionNumber.description: County provided building record section indicator that represents one section of the building only. This is only found in large commercial and multi-family buildings that are divided into multiple sections. Example: West Wing and East Wing.

vacantCount.description: County provided number of vacant units in the building.

residentialCount.description: Total separate apartments or units in a multi-family residential building.

commercialCount.description: County provided total separate business units located within a commercial building.

storiesCount.description: Number of stories associated with the building.

storiesTypeCode.description: Type / number of stories (e.g., Split Foyer, Tri Level, 2 Story).

floorNumber.description: County-specified data that identifies the number of a specific floor or level of a building. Generally used for Condominium units. Example: 59

primaryCategoryCode.description: CoreLogic proprietary transaction classification code that identifies the type of transaction.

deedCategoryCode.description: CoreLogic proprietary deed category type code that identifies the class of recorded legal document.

saleDateDerived.description: CoreLogic proprietary sale date derived from the original public record filing, representing the date that the Deed was prepared in advance of being notarized and prior to being recorded. Format: YYYY-MM-DD.

saleRecordingDateDerived.description: CoreLogic proprietary sale recording date derived from the original public record filing, representing the date the sales transaction was recorded at the county. This date is generally considered the transfer of ownership date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD.

saleAmount.description: Dollar amount of the most recent sale of the property.

saleTypeCode.description: This field indicates what the financial consideration is - if a Deed record represents a change of ownership (Sale).

saleDocumentTypeCode.description: The type of deed used to record the sales transaction (e.g., Grant, Quit, Foreclosure).

saleDocumentNumber.description: The document number used by some counties to record sales transactions - typically a Grant or Warranty Deed.

saleBookNumber.description: The Book number used by some counties to catalog their sales recordings.

salePageNumber.description: The Page number used by some counties to catalog their sales recordings.

ownershipTransferPercent.description: A percentile showing the percentage of ownership transferred.

multiOrSplitParcelCode.description: Indicates either that the transaction involves multiple parcels, or the split of an existing parcel.

isCashPurchase.description: CoreLogic proprietary value that identifies if the property was a cash-based arms-length transaction. 0 = not applicable, 1= applicable.

isMortgagePurchase.description: CoreLogic proprietary value that identifies if the property has a mortgage. 0 = not applicable, 1= applicable.

isInterfamilyRelated.description: CoreLogic proprietary value that indicates if a potential relationship between the seller and the buyer of the property exists. This could be interfamily, intercompany, or trust transfer (non-arms length transaction).  0 = not applicable, 1= applicable.

isInvestorPurchase.description: CoreLogic proprietary value that indicates if the buyer bought the property for investment purposes. 0 = not applicable, 1= applicable.

isResale.description: CoreLogic standardized value that indicates whether the transaction is considered a resale of an existing property. 0 = not applicable, 1= applicable.

isShortSale.description: CoreLogic proprietary indicator that identifies if the property sale is considered a short sale.  0 = not applicable, 1= applicable.

isForeclosureReo.description: CoreLogic proprietary value that indicates whether the transaction was a completed foreclosure where the bank took back ownership of the property (REO).  0 = not applicable, 1= applicable.

isForeclosureReoSale.description: CoreLogic proprietary value that indicates that the bank sold the REO to a third party. 0 = not applicable, 1= applicable.

typeCode.description: The type and/or finish of the exterior wall (e.g., Vinyl Siding, Brick Veneer, Frame / Stone).
CoreLogic standardized code that identifies the type of interior wall construction of a building. Example DRY = Drywall used for interior wall.

etalCode.description: A code appearing in this field indicates additional ownership, whose name(s) were not provided by our sources.  Values are: A = ET AL - AND OTHERS, C = ET CON - AND HUSBAND, U = ET UX - AND WIFE, V = ET VIR - AND HUSBAND.

ownershipRightsCode.description: CoreLogic standardized code that indicates the type of vesting for current borrower or borrowers.

ownershipRightsCodeDescription.description: Describes the value of the ownershipRightsCode.

relationshipTypeCode.description: CoreLogic standardized code that indicates the type of vesting for current borrower or borrowers.

relationshipTypeCodeDescription.description: CoreLogic standardized description that identifies the relationship status of the current borrowers. Defines the code found in Borrower Relationship Type Code element.

borrowerCorporateIndicator.description: Indicator that the BORROWER has been recognized as a corporation or business.

lenderCompanyCode.description: CoreLogic standardized lender code that identifies the mortgage lender (e.g., Bank of America = 000003).

lenderCompanyName.description: CoreLogic proprietary and standardized name of lender from CoreLogic proprietary Lender Code table.

lenderFullName.description: Full name of Lender as recorded on the original document when no CoreLogic Lender Company Code exists.

lenderLastName.description: Name of Lender's Last Name as recorded on the original document when Lender is a Private Party.

lenderFirstName.description: Name of Lender's First Name as recorded on the original document when Lender is a Private Party.

lenderAddress.description: Address of the Lender as recorded on the original document.

lenderCity.description: Lender City as recorded on the original document.

lenderState.description: Lender State as recorded on the original document.

lenderZipCode.description: Lender ZIP code as recorded on the original document.

lenderPostToCode.description: Standardized grouped Lender Code when 2 or more Lender Name variations exist or when CoreLogic aggregates smaller lenders into a single group (Exp. 000252.)

lenderPostToName.description: Corresponding Lender Name that correlates with Lender Post-To Code. (Exp. 000252 matches to Other Institution Lenders.)

initialResetDate.description: CoreLogic derived interest rate change date for an adjustable mortgage. First interest rate reset date. Format: YYYYMMDD.

changeInterval.description: Identifies the number of intervals for interest rate changes for an adjustable mortgage. Numeric value in conjunction with MORTGAGE ARM FREQUENCY.

frequency.description: Indicates the measurement of time in relation to the interest rate reset/change of the adjustable mortgage. Values: W = Weekly; M = Monthly; Q = Quarterly; Y = Yearly.

calculationChange.description: Percentage points added to the Index rate to calculate the new interest rate. Value added to current index to determine new interest rate. Only for adjustable rate mortgages.

maximumInterestRate.description: Maximum interest rate allowed per the life of the loan. Lifetime interest rate maximum. Only for adjustable rate mortgages.
