indexType.description: Indicates which index is used to determine the adjustable mortgage interest rate. Values: LIB = LIBOR, CMT = Constant Maturity Treasury, MTA = Monthly Treasury Average, LAM = LAMA, PRM = Prime, DIS = 11th District, BIL = Treasury Bill, FNM = FNMA (Fannie Mae), OTH = Other

changePercentLimit.description: Maximum amount the interest rate may increase or decrease for any one adjustment period of the adjustable mortgage. Limit on interest rate change for any single adjustment.

initialChangeMaxPercent.description: Maximum interest rate the adjustable mortgage loan rate can increase from the initial interest rate as per the recorded loan documents. Maximum allowable interest rate indicated on initial reset.

lookbackPeriod.description: The number of days back from interest rate change date to acquire index value.

paymentChangeDate.description: Date of payment change (if different than interest rate change date). Format: YYYYMMDD.

payOptionIndicator.description: CoreLogic standardized flag that indicates if the mortgage loan has payment options such as interest only, interest and principal or interest and principal with a lump sum. '0 or null = Not Applicable, 1 = Applicable'.

interestOnlyIndicator.description: CoreLogic standardized flag that indicates the mortgage loan is an interest only payment loan. '0 or null = Not Applicable, 1 = Applicable'.

negativeAmortizationIndicator.description: CoreLogic standardized flag that indicates if the mortgage loan has a negative amortization clause. '0 or null = Not Applicable, 1 = Applicable'.

prepaymentRiderIndicator.description: CoreLogic standardized value that indicates if the mortgage loan contains an adjustable or variable rate rider. 'Y' = Prepayment Rider present.

categoryCode.description: CoreLogic internal code that identifies the type of Adjustable Rate Mortgage (ARM) loan. Values: NULL = Not Applicable, A = Alternative, H = Hybrid, O = Other, S = Subprime, R = Reverse

plannedUnitDevelopmentRiderIndicator.description: Indicates if a Planned Unit Development (PUD) Rider was recorded with the mortgage loan. 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

multifamilyRiderIndicator.description: Indicates if a Multifamily Rider was recorded with the mortgage loan. 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

condominiumRiderIndicator.description: Indicates if a Condominium Rider was recorded with the mortgage loan. 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

secondHomeRiderIndicator.description: Indicates if a  Second Home Rider was recorded with the mortgage loan. 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

variableRiderIndicator.description: CoreLogic standardized value that indicates if the mortgage loan contains an adjustable or variable rate rider.

multiOrSplitParcelCode.description: CoreLogic standardized code that identifies which parcel is being referenced in a multiple or split parcel sale. Values: EMPTY/NULL = Not applicable, M = First parcel of a multiple parcel transaction, D = Subsequent parcel of a multiple parcel transaction, S = Single parcel transaction where parcel is annotated as a portion of or with other property, Z = Multiple parcel transaction where parcel is annotated as a portion of or with other property.

primaryCategoryCode.description: CoreLogic proprietary transaction classification code that identifies the type of transaction. Used with Primary Category Code Description element.

deedCategoryCode.description: CoreLogic proprietary deed category type code that identifies the class of recorded legal document.

amount.description: The amount of the mortgage at the time of the transaction.

date.description: Borrower's signature date on mortgage/deed of trust.  This represents the date the borrower's obligation to the lender begins, i.e. loan open date.  This date is the same or prior to the recording date. If the day and/or month is missing, CoreLogic populates these values with 00. Format: YYYYMMDD.

recordingDate.description: The date the mortgage transaction was recorded at the county.  Format: YYYYMMDD.

interestRateTypeCode.description: CoreLogic standardized value indicating the type of mortgage interest rate. Values: NULL = Unknown, ADJ = Adjustable, BAL = Balloon, FIX = Fixed

interestRate.description: Beginning interest rate per the recorded loan documents for Adjustable Rate Mortgage and the fixed interest rate for all other mortgage records.

loanTypeCode.description: Type of loan secured (e.g., Conventional, FHA, VA).

documentTypeCode.description: Type of deed used for recording (e.g., Mortgage, Loan Modification Agreement, Deed of Trust).

documentNumber.description: The document number used by some counties to record mortgage transactions.

documentBookNumber.description: The Book number used by some counties to catalog their mortgage recordings.

documentPageNumber.description: The Page number used by some counties to catalog their mortgage recordings.

termCode.description: Code used to identify whether the number stored in MORTGAGE TERM is in days, months or years.

term.description: Specific time period that identifies the mortgage due or maturity term. Corresponds with the MORTGAGE TERM CODE field.

dueDate.description: The date the mortgage becomes due. If the day and/or month is missing, CoreLogic populates these values with '00'.  Format: YYYYMMDD.  May be derived.

mortgageTypeCode.description: CoreLogic standardized mortgage classification for principal mortgages ('P'urchase, 'R'efinance) or subordinate mortgages ('J'unior). Won't be populated on pending record.

purposeCode.description: CoreLogic standardized value indicating the reason for the principal or subordinate mortgage. Won't be populated on pending record. Values: A = Cash out first, B = Rate/Term reduction, C = Piggy-back on purchase, D = Standalone subordinate, E = First with subordinate, F = New first mortgage, K = Consolidation, L = Undetermined first mortgage, M = Undetermined standalone subordinate, N = Piggy-back on refinance, O = HUD reverse mortgage, P = First trust modification, Q = Junior trust modification, V = Reverse mortgage

subordinateTypeCode.description: CoreLogic standardized value indicating the type of subordinate mortgage secured. (e.g., 'C'redit Line, 'E'quity, Ba'L'loon)  Won't be populated on pending record.

downPayment.description: Cash down amount at time of purchase (Available in limited geographies only).

lienPosition.description: The order a mortgage is in lien prioirty for all open mortgages.

statusIndicator.description: Corelogic standardized value indicating if a mortgage is currently open, closed by event, in pre-foreclosure, or foreclosed. Values: R = Mortgage Released, P = Mortgage Paid Off, O = Open Mortgage, U = Foreclosed On, F = Pre-Foreclosure Filed, Null = Undetermined

releaseDate.description: Recording date of the mortgage Release/Reconveyance. Format: YYYYMMDD

payoffType.description: Corelogic standardized value that indicates the type of event used to determine mortgage was paid in full. Values: A = Subsequent arm length sale, B = Subsequent non-arm length sale that is classified to pay off mortgage, C = Paid off by a consolidation, modification and extension agreement (DocTyp = "CE", New York only), E = Non-construction balloon mortgage that expired, F = Subsequent purchase or refinance mortgage, H = Release for the mortgage was recorded, Null = Not paid off

payoffDate.description: Date of the event that paid off the mortgage in full.  The event can be a release/reconveyance (hard-close), or can be derived from logic to determine mortgage was paid in full. Format: YYYYMMDD

clip.description: Corelogic Unique identification number assigned to each property.

principalTitle.description: Title of first signatory on Mortgage or Deed of Trust.

principalFullName.description: Full name of first signatory or Company Name on the Mortgage or Deed of Trust.

principalFirstName.description: First name of first signatory on the Mortgage/Deed of Trust.

principalMiddleInitial.description: Middle Name of first signatory on the Mortgage/Deed of Trust.

principalLastName.description: Last name of first signatory on the Mortgage/Deed of Trust.

purchaseRecordingDate.description: Date the most recent purchase of the property was recorded at the county. Format: YYYYMMDD.

purchaseAmount.description: Dollar amount of the most recent purchase of the property.

totalNumberOfOpenMortgageLiens.description: Total number of open mortgage liens against the property.

totalAmountOfOpenMortgageLiens.description: Sum total of origination amounts of open mortgage liens against the property.

purchaseCombinedLTV.description: Ratio of purchase mortgages against purchase amount. Value expressed as a percentage.

estimatedEquity.description: Estimated difference between current AVM value and the sum of all open, original loan amounts, for all open liens.  Uses THVx for AVM that provides highest hit rate for use cases, such as segmentation, and validating consumer-reported home value estimates at time of application.

estimatedCombinedLTV.description: Estimated ratio of the sum amount of all open liens at origination divided into the current AVM value. Uses THVx for AVM that provides highest hit rate for use cases. Value expressed as a percentage.

clip.description: Unique identification number assigned to each property.

aep50.description: 50-Year Annual Exceedance Probability. Loss level with a 1-in-50 (2%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the total losses each year.

aep100.description: 100-Year Annual Exceedance Probability. Loss level with a 1-in-100 (1%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the total losses each year.

aep200.description: 200-Year Annual Exceedance Probability.  Loss level with a 1-in-200 (0.5%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the total losses each year. Applies to AR6 SSPs only.

aep500.description: 500-Year Annual Exceedance Probability. Loss level with a 1-in-500 (0.2%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the total losses each year.

aep50Tvar.description: 50-Year Annual Exceedance Probability Tail Value-at-Risk. Average of all losses above the level with a 1-in-50 (2%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the total losses each year and the potential for extreme losses.

aep100Tvar.description: 100-Year Annual Exceedance Probability Tail Value-at-Risk. Average of all losses above the level with a 1-in-100 (1%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the total losses each year and the potential for extreme losses.

aep200Tvar.description: 200-Year Annual Exceedance Probability Tail Value-at-Risk. Average of all losses above the level with a 1-in-200 (0.5%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the total losses each year and the potential for extreme losses. Applies to AR6 SSPs only.

aep500Tvar.description: 500-Year Annual Exceedance Probability Tail Value-at-Risk. Average of all losses above the level with a 1-in-500 (0.2%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the total losses each year and the potential for extreme losses.

clip.description: CoreLogic Unique identification number assigned to each property.

fipsCode.description: Federal Information Processing Standards codes used nationally to numerically identify a specific county or political jurisdiction.

modelVersion.description: A unique version identifying the ensemble of models used to produce this data.

modelRunDate.description: The date the model estimated the values. Format: YYYYMMDD

oep50.description: 50-Year Occurrence Exceedance Probability. Loss level with a 1-in-50 (2%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the largest loss each year.

oep100.description: 100-Year Occurrence Exceedance Probability. Loss level with a 1-in-100 (1%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the largest loss each year.

oep200.description: 200-Year Occurrence Exceedance Probability.  Loss level with a 1-in-200 (0.5%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the largest loss each year.  Applies to AR6 SSPs only.

oep500.description: 500-Year Occurrence Exceedance Probability. Loss level with a 1-in-500 (0.2%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the largest loss each year.

oep50Tvar.description: 50-Year Occurrence Exceedance Probability Tail Value-at-Risk. Average of all losses above the level with a 1-in-50 (2%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the largest loss each year and the potential for extreme losses.

oep100Tvar.description: 100-Year Occurrence Exceedance Probability Tail Value-at-Risk. Average of all losses above the level with a 1-in-100 (1%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the largest loss each year and the potential for extreme losses.

oep200Tvar.description: 200-Year Occurrence Exceedance Probability Tail Value-at-Risk. Average of all losses above the level with a 1-in-200 (0.5%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the largest loss each year and the potential for extreme losses. Applies to AR6 SSPs only.

oep500Tvar.description: 500-Year Occurrence Exceedance Probability Tail Value-at-Risk. Average of all losses above the level with a 1-in-500 (0.2%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the largest loss each year and the potential for extreme losses.

perilId.description: The Peril ID for that record. (e.g. EQSH, FIXX, etc.)

description.description: The description for the Peril ID for the record.

timeHorizon.description: The climate timeframe is the timeframe for the record. (e.g., 0 represents Current, 2030, 2040, 2050) Format: YYYY

averageAnnualLossRatio.description: Long-term Average Annual Loss expressed as a ratio.  This represents the ratio between long-term average annual loss and replacement cost.

averageAnnualLossRiskScore.description: Values range from 0 to 100, based on the Average Annual Loss relative to all properties in the given risk type score group (SFR, MFR, COM, IND, MUN, AGR) nationwide. 0 indicates the peril isn't modeled for the given location. If a peril is modeled for the given location, 1 indicates the lowest risk and 100 indicates the highest risk.

craRecordId.description: An identifier that uniquely identifies a structure or a parcel within this dataset and run date.

latitude.description: CoreLogic proprietary parcel-centroid coordinate that specifies the north-south position of the center point of a parcel. The latitude contains numeric data values only conforming to the mask XX.ZZZZZZ, where the XX are the digits to the left of the decimal point, and ZZZZZZ are the digits to the right of the decimal point. Latitude is always a positive value on the North American continent.

longitude.description: CoreLogic proprietary parcel-centroid coordinate that specifies the east-west position of the center point of a parcel. The longitude contains numeric data values only conforming to the mask -XXX.ZZZZZZ, where the XXX are the numeric digits to the left of the decimal point, and ZZZZZZ are the 6 numeric digits to the right of the decimal point. Longitude is a negative value on the North American continent.

riskTypeScoreGroup.description: Groups where the scores are calculated (SFR, MFR, COM, IND, AGR, MUN - representing Single-Family Residential, Multi-Family Residential, Commercial, Industrial, Agricultural and Municipal).

climateScenarioCode.description: Scenario codes include SSP (Shared Socioeconomic Pathways) for SSP1_2.6; SSP2_4.5; SSP5_8.5 and RCP ( Representative Concentration Pathways) for RCP2.6; RCP4.5 and RCP8.5.  RCP2.6 is considered Favorable Climate response, RCP4.5 is considered Moderate Climate response and RCP8.5 is considered Severe Climate response.  (BASE represents Current.)  Data is delivered without a decimal i.e., SSP1_26, SSP2_45, RCP45, etc.

aep50.description: 50-Year Annual Exceedance Probability. Loss level with a 1-in-50 (2%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the total losses each year.

aep100.description: 100-Year Annual Exceedance Probability. Loss level with a 1-in-100 (1%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the total losses each year.

aep250.description: 250-Year Annual Exceedance Probability. Loss level with a 1-in-250 (0.4%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the total losses each year.

aep500.description: 500-Year Annual Exceedance Probability. Loss level with a 1-in-500 (0.2%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the total losses each year.

aep50.description: 50-Year Annual Exceedance Probability. Average of all losses above the level with a 1-in-50 (2%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the total losses each year.

aep100.description: 100-Year Annual Exceedance Probability. Average of all losses above the level with a 1-in-100 (1%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the total losses each year.

aep250.description: 250-Year Annual Exceedance Probability. Average of all losses above the level with a 1-in-250 (0.4%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the total losses each year.

aep500.description: 500-Year Annual Exceedance Probability. Average of all losses above the level with a 1-in-500 (0.2%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the total losses each year.

clip.description: CoreLogic Unique identification number assigned to each property.

fipsCode.description: Federal Information Processing Standards codes used nationally to numerically identify a specific county or political jurisdiction.

modelVersion.description: A unique version identifying the ensemble of models used to produce this data.

modelRunDate.description: The date the model estimated the values. Format: YYYYMMDD

perilId.description: The Peril ID for that record. (e.g. EQSH, FIXX, etc.)

perilIdDescription.description: The description for the Peril ID for the record.

craRecordId.description: An identifier that uniquely identifies a structure or a parcel within this dataset and run date.

latitude.description: CoreLogic proprietary parcel-centroid coordinate that specifies the north-south position of the center point of a parcel. The latitude contains numeric data values only conforming to the mask XX.ZZZZZZ, where the XX are the digits to the left of the decimal point, and ZZZZZZ are the digits to the right of the decimal point. Latitude is always a positive value north on the North American continent.

longitude.description: CoreLogic proprietary parcel-centroid coordinate that specifies the east-west position of the center point of a parcel. The longitude contains numeric data values only conforming to the mask -XXX.ZZZZZZ, where the XXX are the numeric digits to the left of the decimal point, and ZZZZZZ are the 6 numeric digits to the right of the decimal point. Longitude is negative on the North American continent.

riskTypeScoreGroup.description: Groups where the scores are calculated (SFR, MFR, COM, IND, AGR, MUN - representing Single-Family Residential, Multi-Family Residential, Commercial, Industrial, Agricultural and Municipal).

rcpScenario.description: The climate risk scenario for this record. Scenarios include RCP - Representative Concentration Pathways for Current, RCP 2.6; RCP 4.5 and RCP 8.5. RCP 2.6 is considered Favorable Climate response, RCP 4.5 is considered Moderate Climate response and RCP 8.5 is considered Severe Climate response. (BASE represents Current. RCP data is delivered without a decimal i.e. RCP2.6 is delivered as RCP26.)

timeHorizon.description: The climate timeframe for this record. (e.g. 0 represents Current, 2030, 2040, 2050) Format: YYYY

averageAnnualLossRatio.description: Long-term Annual Average Loss per year

averageAnnualLossRiskScore.description: Values range from 0 to 100, based on the Average Annual Loss relative to all properties in the given risk type score group (SFR, MFR, COM, IND, MUN, AGR) nationwide. 0 indicates the peril isn't modeled for the given location. If a peril is modeled for the given location, 1 indicates the lowest risk and 100 indicates the highest risk.

oep50.description: 50-Year Occurrence Exceedance Probability. Loss level with a 1-in-50 (2%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the largest loss each year.

oep100.description: 100-Year Occurrence Exceedance Probability. Loss level with a 1-in-100 (1%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the largest loss each year.

oep250.description: 250-Year Occurrence Exceedance Probability. Loss level with a 1-in-250 (0.4%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the largest loss each year

oep500.description: 500-Year Occurrence Exceedance Probability. Loss level with a 1-in-500 (0.2%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the largest loss each year.

oep50.description: 50-Year Occurrence Exceedance Probability. Average of all losses above the level with a 1-in-50 (2%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the largest loss each year.

oep100.description: 100-Year Occurrence Exceedance Probability. Average of all losses above the level with a 1-in-100 (1%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the largest loss each year.

oep250.description: 250-Year Occurrence Exceedance Probability. Average of all losses above the level with a 1-in-250 (0.4%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the largest loss each year.

oep500.description: 500-Year Occurrence Exceedance Probability. Average of all losses above the level with a 1-in-500 (0.2%) chance of being exceeded in any given year, based on the largest loss each year.

status.description: The status or statuses of the permit in the building and approval process, standardized. Each status is paired with Permit Effective Date.

effectiveDate.description: The effective date of the Permit Status for which it is paired.

clip.description: Unique identification number assigned to each property.

name.description: The geographical description of the source for this building permit.

firstCollectionDate.description: This represents the building permit collection point start date or date the first building permit was collected.

lastCollectionDate.description: This represents the building permit collection point end date or date the most recent permit was collected.

permitsCollectedCount.description: This represents the number of building permits that have been collected for the collection point.

id.description: The unique proprietary identifier assigned to each Contractor entity. The Contractor entity's Building Permit entity matches are reconciled onto this identifier.

businessName.description: The name of the construction company that submitted the building permit.

type.description: The normalized description of contractor type, specified by the Contractor Entity.

website.description: The website of the construction company that submitted the building permit.

id.description: The unique proprietary identifier assigned to each Building Permit entity. The Property entity's Building Permit entity matches are reconciled onto this identifier.

number.description: The official permit number as provided by the permit issuing agency.

mostRecentStatusSource.description: The most recent stage of the permit in the building and approval process, standardized. This is paired with Permit Effective Date.

expirationDate.description: The permit's expiration date which can be assigned upon permit issuance. Certain permits are issued/approved but given a time limit for completion, i.e. expiration of approval by the city or county to complete the work. This field reflects the date, if any, when approved permits must complete the work on the subject property. Null if not applicable to a specific permit.  Format: "YYYY-MM-DD"

filingFees.description: The building permit fees paid to the presiding building permit authority. In absence of a declared job value, the fees are a reasonable, directional estimate to the size and scale of a project.

unitsCount.description: The description of the nature of work requiring the permit as specified by the project owner on the permit.

storiesCount.description: The number of stories in the relevant structure as reported on the building permit.

areaSquareFeet.description: The estimated square feet of the project as reported on the building permit.

homeOwnerName.description: The name of the home/property owner as specified on the building permit.

projectType.description: The normalized description of service performed.

projectTypeCategory.description: Standardized category identifying the type of service performed.

name.description: The project title for the permit as specified by the project owner on the permit.

description.description: The description of the nature of work requiring the permit as specified by the project owner on the permit.

jobValue.description: The job value estimate provided by the contractor on the permit. This value is provided prior to the start of work.

type.description: The category or type of work the permit is for as specified on the building permit. Values vary by issuing agency. E.g. Mechanical, electrical.

subType.description: The subtype of work the permit is for as specified by the building permit. Values vary by issuing agency. E.g. Appliance replacement.

clip.description: CoreLogic unique identification number assigned to each comparable property.

v1PropertyId.description: Unique identification number assigned to each comparable property in legacy application.

baths.description: Total number of rooms that are bathrooms in the comparable property. Format: whole number.

bedrooms.description: CoreLogic calculated total bedrooms for the building.

buildingSquareFeet.description: The size of the building in square feet. This field is most commonly populated as an aggregate total when a county does not differentiate between living and non-living areas.

city.description: The city associated with the property address.

distance.description: The distance in miles from the subject property.

latitude.description: CoreLogic derived geographic coordinate that specifies the north-south position of a point based on United States Postal Service address data for the parcel. The latitude contains numeric data values only conforming to the mask XX.ZZZZZZ, where the XX are the digits to the left of the decimal point, and ZZZZZZ are the digits to the right of the decimal point. Latitude is always a positive value north on the North American continent.

longitude.description: CoreLogic derived geographic coordinate that specifies the east-west position of a point based on United States Postal Service address data for the parcel. The longitude contains numeric data values only conforming to the mask -XXX.ZZZZZZ, where the XXX are the numeric digits to the left of the decimal point, and ZZZZZZ are the 6 numeric digits to the right of the decimal point. Longitude is negative on the North American continent.

lotSquareFeet.description: Total land mass in square feet.

pricePerSquareFoot.description: CoreLogic compiled and calculated listed property price per square feet.

recordingDate.description: The date the sales transaction of the comparable property was recorded at the county. This date is generally considered the transfer of ownership date. Format: YYYYMMDD.

saleDate.description: Date the contract, deed or document of the comparable property was signed. Format: YYYYMMDD.

salePrice.description: Dollar amount of the most recent sale of the comparable  property.

state.description: The two-letter USPS postal abbreviation associated with the state / protectorates / commonwealth (e.g., CA, VI).

streetAddress.description: Full Situs address (not including City/St/Zip) (e.g. 123 N Main St)

yearBuilt.description: This is the construction year of the original building on the parcel as provided by the county. Not all counties maintain both Original and Effective Year Built. Null if not available from the source. Format: YYYY

zip.description: Code assigned by the USPS. This is populated by various source files and other proprietary and non-proprietary processes. Data may be the 5-digit zip or 9-digit Zip+4 (e.g., 00501 or 954630042).

clip.description: CoreLogic unique identification number assigned to each subject property.

v1PropertyId.description: Unique identification number assigned to each subject property in legacy application.

clip.description: CoreLogic Unique identification number assigned to each property.

v1PropertyId.description: Unique identification number assigned to each property in Legacy application.

address.description: The full property address (e.g., 123 N MAIN ST EDMOND OK 73012). May contain the full zip code 73012-4174).

addressLine1.description: Full address line of the property (e.g., 123 N MAIN ST APT. 400)

city.description: The city associated with the property address.

state.description: The two-letter USPS postal abbreviation associated with the state / protectorates / commonwealth (e.g., CA, VI).

propertyMatchScore.description: Score ranging from 0 to 10 indicating the quality of the match between the request information and the found property information. Refer to Property Search User Guide for additional information.

resultCode.description: CoreLogic standardized result of the lookup match based on the input property address information. Refer to Property Search User Guide Appendix B for additional information.

matchCode.description: CoreLogic standardized code detailing how the provided property information (Address, APN, CLIP, Geocode) matched the found property. Refer to Property Search User Guide Appendix C for additional information.

addressType.description: The type of address identified by the CLIP system. Refer to Property Search User Guide for additional information.

addressMatchCode.description: CoreLogic standardized code defining the parameters of the address and latitude/longitude for the property found based on the customer input.

addressMatchCodeDescription.description: Textual description of the CoreLogic standardized address match code.

fipsCode.description: Federal Information Processing Standards codes used nationally to numerically identify a specific county or political jurisdiction.

apnSequenceNumber.description: This internal sequence number is used to ensure uniqueness of the Assessor's Parcel Number.

apnParcelNumberUnformatted.description: Assessor's Parcel Number in an unformatted form. This is most often used by the county and others as a unique key.

apnParcelNumberFormatted.description: Assessor's Parcel Number in a formatted form. This is most often used by the county and others as a unique key.

previousApnUnformatted.description: The prior parcel number if the county changed the number in the last year. Otherwise, the field will be empty.

universalParcelId.description: An Alternate ID provided by some corelogic that can be used to identify a property.

streetAddress.description: CoreLogic standardized street address containing house number, street name, street direction, suffix/prefix, street suffix (e.g. 123 N Main St)

state.description: CoreLogic standardized two-letter state postal abbreviation (e.g. CA, TX)

zipPlus4.description: CoreLogic standardized last 4 digits of a USPS 9-digit zip code, which is used by the local mail carrier to identify the delivery route.

county.description: CoreLogic standardized county name associated with the property address

clip.description: CoreLogic Unique identification number assigned to each property.

v1PropertyId.description: Unique identification number assigned to each property in Legacy application.

clientEchoId.description: UID number assigned to each property search.

houseNumber.description: CoreLogic standardized house number, usually the digits or letters found to the left of a street name in an address

streetNamePrefixDir.description: CoreLogic standardized field that represents the direction found to the left of the street name (e.g. 9340 N Dunhill Dr). Also know as Pre-Directional.

streetName.description: CoreLogic standardized name or number of the street where a parcel is located, this includes any prefixes that are considered to be part of the street name (e.g. Via De Luna, 34th).

streetNameSuffix.description: CoreLogic standardized mode or type of street found to the right of the street name such as Drive, avenue, parkway (e.g., 9340 N Dunhill Dr). Also known as Street Designators / Street modes

streetNameSuffixDir.description: CoreLogic standardized direction indicator that follows the listed property's street name and street mode. Examples: SW following the street number and name in the address, 505 Dean St. SW. Also known as Post Directional.

unitType.description: The unit type of the property adress ( e.g. Apartment, unit)

unitNumber.description: The unit or suite number of the property address (e.g., 649 Lake Shore Dr #1400).

owner1Name.description: Full name of the primary property owner

owner2Name.description: Full name of the secondary property owner

propertyMatchScore.description: Reports the confidence of the appended match to the input data. A higher number means higher confidence. Range is 0-10 with 10 highest append score. 0 is No CLIP. NULL is no match.

propertyMatchCode.description: Provides detailed information regarding how the input information matched to the returned property.
propertyMatchCode.example: Refer Property Match Code for reference

fipsCode.description: Federal Information Processing Standards codes used nationally to numerically identify a specific county or political jurisdiction.

apnSequenceNumber.description: This internal sequence number is used to ensure uniqueness of the Assessor's Parcel Number.

apnParcelNumberUnformatted.description: Assessor's Parcel Number in an unformatted form. This is most often used by the county and others as a unique key.

apnParcelNumberFormatted.description: Assessor's Parcel Number in a formatted form. This is most often used by the county and others as a unique key.

previousApnUnformatted.description: The prior parcel number if the county changed the number in the last year. Otherwise, the field will be empty.

clip.description: Corelogic Unique identification number assigned to each property.

v1PropertyId.description: Unique identification number assigned to each property in Legacy application.

latitude.description: CoreLogic standardized coordinates that specifies the north-south position of the center point of an area. The latitude contains numeric data values only conforming to the format XX.ZZZZZZ, where the XX are the digits to the left of the decimal point, and ZZZZZZ are the digits to the right of the decimal point. Latitude is always a positive value north on the North American continent.

longitude.description: CoreLogic standardized coordinates that specifies the that specifies the east-west position of the center point of an area. The longitude contains numeric data values only conforming to the mask -XXX.ZZZZZZ, where the XXX are the numeric digits to the left of the decimal point, and ZZZZZZ are the 6 numeric digits to the right of the decimal point. Longitude is negative on the North American continent.

clip.description: Corelogic Unique identification number assigned to each property.

v1PropertyId.description: Unique identification number assigned to each property in Legacy application.

clip.description: Unique identification number assigned to each property.

fipsCode.description: Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) code used to identify legal and statistical entities for county subdivisions for a property or transaction. The first two characters identify the state and the next three characters define the county, city or jurisdiction.

modelScore.description: CoreLogic calibrated score that predicts the likelihood of the selected model to occur within the next six months. The score range is from 40 to 985. The higher the number the more likely the prediction will occur.

modelRunDate.description: Date when the model was run.  The model is run on a periodic cycle.  Format = YYYYMMDD

firstHOALienDate.description: Recording date of the earliest homeowner's association lien record in the database for the county.

lastHOALienDate.description: Recording date of the most recent home owner's association lien record available in the database for the County.

firstMechanicsLienDate.description: Recording date of the earliest mechanic lien record in the database for the county.

lastMechanicsLienDate.description: Recording date of the most recent mechanic lien record available in the database for the County.

firstTaxLienDate.description: Recording date of the earliest tax lien record in the database for the county.

lastTaxLienDate.description: Recording date of the most recent tax lien record available in the database for the County.

standardizedCounty.description: CoreLogic standardized county name associated with the property address.

standardizedFIPsCode.description: CoreLogic standardized Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) code that identifies the county and state. The first two characters identify the state, and the next three characters define the county.

standardizedState.description: CoreLogic standardized two-letter state postal abbreviation. (e.g. CA, TX).

clip.description: Corelogic unique identification number assigned to each property.

plaintiffFullName.description: Name of the claimant or representative either taking lien action or releasing a prior lien against the owner.

plaintiffAddress.description: Address of the Plaintiff as recorded on the document.

plaintiffCity.description: Plaintiff City as recorded on the document.

plaintiffState.description: Plaintiff State as recorded on the document.

plaintiffZipCode.description: Plaintiff ZIP code as recorded on the document.

lienOrReleaseRecordingDate.description: The date the LIEN or RELEASE transaction was recorded.  YYYYMMDD

lienOrReleaseFilingDate.description: The date the LIEN or RELEASE document was filed with the court. YYYYMMDD

lienOrReleaseDocumentNumber.description: LIEN or RELEASE Recorders document number, used by some counties to record transactions.

lienOrReleaseDocumentBookNumber.description: LIEN or RELEASE Book number used by some counties to record transactions.

lienOrReleaseDocumentPageNumber.description: LIEN or RELEASE Page number used by some counties to record transactions.

deedCategoryTypeCode.description: CoreLogic proprietary deed category type code that identifies the class of recorded legal document.

deedCategoryTypeCodeDescription.description: Description of DEED CATEGORY TYPE CODE

lienOrReleaseDocTypeCode.description: Type of LIEN or RELEASE lien document recorded.

lienOrReleaseDocTypeCodeDescription.description: Description of LIEN OR RELEASE DOCUMENT TYPE CODE

lienOrReleaseAmount.description: LIEN or RELEASE amount lien for this transaction on the property. Amount is populated on Mechanics and HOA lien records with a DeedCatTyp = ''J'.

lienOrReleaseInterestRate.description: LIEN or RELEASE Interest rate for this transaction on the property..

compositeTransactionHoaLienId.description: Unique HOA Lien transaction key comprised of FIPS Code, Transaction Batch Date, Transaction Sequence Number, and either Mortgage Sequence Number if record reflects mortgage data content or '000' if record does not reflect mortgage data content.

sequenceNumber.description: If there are multiple owners, the sequence number begins with 1 for the first owner and increases by one for each additional property owner.

firstNameMiddleInitial.description: First name and middle initial of property owner

plaintiffFullName.description: Name of the claimant or representative either taking lien action or releasing a prior lien against the owner.

plaintiffAddress.description: Address of the Plaintiff as recorded on the document.

plaintiffCity.description: Plaintiff City as recorded on the document.

plaintiffState.description: Plaintiff State as recorded on the document.

plaintiffZipCode.description: Plaintiff ZIP code as recorded on the document.

lienOrReleaseRecordingDate.description: The date the LIEN or RELEASE transaction was recorded.  YYYYMMDD

lienOrReleaseFilingDate.description: The date the LIEN or RELEASE document was filed with the court. YYYYMMDD

lienOrReleaseDocumentNumber.description: LIEN or RELEASE Recorders document number, used by some counties to record transactions.

lienOrReleaseDocumentBookNumber.description: LIEN or RELEASE Book number used by some counties to record transactions.

lienOrReleaseDocumentPageNumber.description: LIEN or RELEASE Page number used by some counties to record transactions.

deedCategoryTypeCode.description: CoreLogic proprietary deed category type code that identifies the class of recorded legal document.

deedCategoryTypeCodeDescription.description: Description of DEED CATEGORY TYPE CODE

lienOrReleaseDocTypeCode.description: Type of LIEN or RELEASE lien document recorded.

lienOrReleaseDocTypeCodeDescription.description: Description of LIEN OR RELEASE DOCUMENT TYPE CODE

lienOrReleaseAmount.description: LIEN or RELEASE amount lien for this transaction on the property. Amount is populated on Mechanics and HOA lien records with a DeedCatTyp = ''J'.

lienOrReleaseInterestRate.description: LIEN or RELEASE Interest rate for this transaction on the property..

compositeTransactionMechanicsLienId.description: Unique Mechanics Lien transaction key comprised of FIPS Code, Transaction Batch Date, Transaction Sequence Number, and either Mortgage Sequence Number if record reflects mortgage data content or '000' if record does not reflect mortgage data content.

originalLienRecordingDate.description: Recording Date of the original lien transaction associated with this record and refers to prior associated transaction. Format = YYYYMMDD. Typically refers back to the Recording Date of the Lien. To link to the prior transaction, use FIPS + Original Transaction Recording Date + Original Transaction Document Number (or use FIPS + Original Transaction Recording Date + Original Transaction Document Book Number + Original Transaction Document Page Number if Book/Page is the documenter numbering method used by the county).

originalLienDocumentNumber.description: Document Number of the original lien transaction associated with this record and refers to prior associated transaction. Typically refers back to the Document Number of the Lien. To link to the prior transaction, use FIPS + Original Transaction Recording Date + Original Transaction Document Number (or use FIPS + Original Transaction Recording Date + Original Transaction Document Book Number + Original Transaction Document Page Number if Book/Page is the documenter numbering method used by the county).

originalLienDocumentBookNumber.description: Document Book Number of the original lien transaction associated with this record and refers to prior associated transaction. Typically refers back to the Document Book Number of the Lien. To link to the prior transaction, use FIPS + Original Transaction Recording Date + Original Transaction Document Number (or use FIPS + Original Transaction Recording Date + Original Transaction Document Book Number + Original Transaction Document Page Number if Book/Page is the documenter numbering method used by the county).

originalLienDocumentPageNumber.description: Document Page Number of the original lien transaction associated with this record and refers to prior associated transaction. Typically refers back to the Document Page Number of the Lien. To link to the prior transaction, use FIPS + Original Transaction Recording Date + Original Transaction Document Number (or use FIPS + Original Transaction Recording Date + Original Transaction Document Book Number + Original Transaction Document Page Number if Book/Page is the documenter numbering method used by the county).

subjectTransactionRecordingDate.description: Recording Date of the subject transaction associated with this event. Format = YYYYMMDD.  Document sourced, refers to prior associated transaction.  Typically refers back to the Recording Date of the Deed of Trust/Mortgage.  To link to the prior transaction, use FIPS + Subject Transaction Recording Date + Subject Transaction Document Number (or use FIPS + Subject Transaction Recording Date + Subject Transaction Document Book Number + Subject Transaction Document Page Number if Book/Page is the documenter numbering method used by the county).

subjectTransactionDocumentNumber.description: Document Number of the subject transaction associated with this event.  Document sourced, refers to prior associated transaction.  Typically refers back to the Document Number of the Deed of Trust/Mortgage.  To link to the prior transaction, use FIPS + Subject Transaction Recording Date + Subject Transaction Document Number (or use FIPS + Subject Transaction Recording Date + Subject Transaction Document Book Number + Subject Transaction Document Page Number if Book/Page is the documenter numbering method used by the county).

subjectTransactionDocumentBookNumber.description: Document Book Number of the subject transaction associated with this event.  Document sourced, refers to prior associated transaction.  Typically refers back to the Document Book Number of the Deed of Trust/Mortgage.  To link to the prior transaction, use FIPS + Subject Transaction Recording Date + Subject Transaction Document Number (or use FIPS + Subject Transaction Recording Date + Subject Transaction Document Book Number + Subject Transaction Document Page Number if Book/Page is the documenter numbering method used by the county).

subjectTransactionDocumentPageNumber.description: Document Page Number of the subject transaction associated with this event.  Document sourced, refers to prior associated transaction.  Typically refers back to the Document Page Number of the Deed of Trust/Mortgage.  To link to the prior transaction, use FIPS + Subject Transaction Recording Date + Subject Transaction Document Number (or use FIPS + Subject Transaction Recording Date + Subject Transaction Document Book Number + Subject Transaction Document Page Number if Book/Page is the documenter numbering method used by the county).

taxLienAliasTypeCode.description:
Identifies the reason for the alias name as in Doing Business As (DBA).
Values: AAR = Also Appear on Record, ABN = Also Business Name, ADO = A Division Of, AKA = Also Known As, ASO = A Subrogee Of, ATF = As Trustee For, CKA = Commonly Known As, DBA = Doing Business As, FBO = For Benefit Of, FDBA = Formerly Doing Business As, FKA = Formerly Known As, FNO = Full Name Of, HTTA = Has Taken Title As, KA = Known As, KBM = Known Beyond Marriage, KNA = Known Now As, NBM = Name Beyond Marriage, NKA = Now Known As, PDBA = Previously Doing Business As, PKA = Previously Known As, QI = Qualified Intermediary, SBM = Successor By Merger/To, SKA = Sometime Known As/Same Known As, TA = Titled As, UTA = Under Trust Agreement Of, WATA = Who Acquired Titled As.

taxpayerIdNumber.description:
Taxpayer ID number that identifies the taxpayer (not a social security number) on federal, state, city and county tax liens and can include special characters, such as hyphens.
Note: Multiple ID number records are created when multiple taxpayers or defendants are listed on a tax lien document.

taxLienNumber.description: Tax lien, serial or certificate number.

taxLienDate.description:
If the document is a tax lien release, this date is the tax lien release date. Otherwise, this date is the tax lien date, which is the date the document was executed at its source - county, city, federal or state. 
Format: YYYYMMDD

taxLienPeriodBeginMinimumDate.description:
Beginning date of the tax lien period. 
Format: YYYYMMDD

taxLienPeriodEndMaximumDate.description:
End date of the tax lien period
Format: YYYYMMDD

taxLienLastRefilingOrLienExtensionDate.description:
Last date to refile or extend a tax lien, as noted on the tax lien document. 
Format: YYYYMMDD

taxLienRecordingDate.description: The date the tax lien transaction was recorded at the county recorder or Register of Deeds office.  Format: YYYYMMDD

taxLienRecordedDocumentNumber.description: The tax lien's unique document number assigned by the county recorder or Register of Deeds office.

taxLienRecordedDocumentBookNumber.description: The Book number used by some counties to record tax lien transactions.

taxLienRecordedDocumentPageNumber.description: The Page number used by some counties to record tax lien transactions.

taxLienDeedCategoryTypeCode.description:
CoreLogic proprietary deed category type code that identifies the class of recorded tax lien legal document.
Values:
J = Liens
R = Releases of liens

taxLienDocumentTypeCode.description: Type of tax lien document recorded.

taxLienDocumentTypeCodeDescription.description: Description of tax lien document recorded.

taxLienCreditorCompanyName.description:
Entity on the Tax Lien. The following preferences are used to prioritize the entity on the document:
1st = agency that requested recording
2nd = entity responsible for notice/lien
3rd = Other wording (in favor of, indebted to, to be paid to, etc.)
Examples:
County of Nevada Tax Collector
Department of Child Support Services

taxLienEstimatedAmount.description: Dollar amount of the tax lien listed. Occasionally, the document does not include a tax lien amount. Examples: $4387.38 = 4387.38 $13,765.00 = 13765.00

taxpayerMailingHouseNumber.description: The digits found to the left of a street name, representing the house number for the mailing address.

taxpayerMailingHouseNumberSuffix.description: The characters found to the immediate right of a house number (e.g., 202B Jones Rd).

taxpayerMailingHouseNumber2.description: The second set of numbers in an address range.

taxpayerMailingDirection.description: This field represents the direction found to the left of the street name (e.g., 9340 N Dunhill Dr). AKA Directional Abbreviations, Pre-Directional.

taxpayerMailingStreetName.description: The name or number of the street of the mailing address.

taxpayerMailingMode.description: The Mode or Type of street found to the right of the street name (e.g., 9340 N Dunhill Dr). AKA Street Designators / Street Suffixes.

taxpayerMailingQuadrant.description: The quadrant is found to the right of Mailing Mode (e.g., 2040 NW 100 ST SW). AKA Post-Directional.

taxpayerMailingUnitNumber.description: The unit or suite number of the mailing address (e.g., 649 Lake Shore Dr #1400).

taxpayerMailingCity.description: The city associated with the mailing address.

taxpayerMailingState.description: The two-letter USPS postal abbreviation associated with the state / protectorates / commonwealth (e.g., CA, VI, PR).

taxpayerMailingZipCode.description: Code assigned by the USPS. This is populated by various source files and other proprietary and non-proprietary processes. Data may be the 5-digit zip or 9-digit Zip+4 (e.g., 00501 or 954630042).

taxpayerMailingCarrierRoute.description: This is the four digit code used by the local mail carrier to identify the delivery path.

taxpayerMailingStreetAddress.description: Full mail address (not including City/St/Zip) (e.g. 123 N Main St). This also contains unparsed foreign mailing address.

taxpayerFirstName.description: First name of the taxpayer or company name on a tax lien. The value  "RECORD" means the name is illegible or left blank.

taxpayerMiddleNameOrMiddleInitial.description: Middle initial or name of the taxpayer on a tax lien.

taxpayerLastName.description: Last name of the taxpayer on a tax lien.

taxpayerSuffix.description: Suffix of the taxpayer on a tax lien.

initialResetDate.description: CoreLogic derived interest rate change date for an adjustable mortgage. First interest rate reset date. Format: YYYYMMDD.

nextResetDate.description: Next interest rate change date after first change. Format: YYYYMMDD.

changeInterval.description: Identifies the number of intervals for interest rate changes for an adjustable mortgage. Numeric value in conjunction with MORTGAGE ARM FREQUENCY.

frequency.description: Indicates the measurement of time in relation to the interest rate reset/change of the adjustable mortgage. Values: W = Weekly; M = Monthly; Q = Quarterly; Y = Yearly.

calculationChange.description: Percentage points added to the Index rate to calculate the new interest rate. Value added to current index to determine new interest rate.  Only for adjustable rate mortgages.

maximumInterestRate.description: Maximum interest rate allowed per the life of the loan.  Lifetime interest rate maximum.  Only for adjustable rate mortgages.

indexTypeCode.description: Indicates which index is used to determine the adjustable mortgage interest rate. Values: LIB = LIBOR, CMT = Constant Maturity Treasury, MTA = Monthly Treasury Average, LAM = LAMA, PRM = Prime, DIS = 11th District, BIL = Treasury Bill, FNM = FNMA (Fannie Mae), SOF = SOFR, OTH = Other

changePercentLimit.description: Maximum amount the interest rate may increase or decrease for any one adjustment period of the adjustable mortgage.  Limit on interest rate change for any single adjustment.

initialChangeMaxPercent.description: Maximum interest rate the adjustable mortgage loan rate can increase from the initial interest rate as per the recorded loan documents. Maximum allowable interest rate indicated on initial reset.

lookbackPeriod.description: The number of days back from interest rate change date to acquire index value.

paymentChangeDate.description: Date of payment change (if different than interest rate change date). Format: YYYYMMDD.

payOptionIndicator.description: CoreLogic standardized flag that indicates if the mortgage loan has payment options such as interest only, interest and principal or interest and principal with a lump sum. Values:  0 or null = Not Applicable, 1 = Applicable

interestOnlyIndicator.description: CoreLogic standardized flag that indicates the mortgage loan is an interest only payment loan. '0 or null = Not Applicable, 1 = Applicable'.

negativeAmortizationIndicator.description: CoreLogic standardized flag that indicates if the mortgage loan has a negative amortization clause. '0 or null = Not Applicable, 1 = Applicable'.

companyCode.description: CoreLogic standardized lender code of current assigned lender for the open lien (e.g., Bank of America = 000003).

companyName.description: Name of current assigned lender for the open lien.

lastName.description: Name of Lender's Last Name of current assigned lender for the open lien.

firstName.description: Name of Lender's First Name of current assigned lender for the open lien.

address.description: Address of the Lender of current assigned lender for the open lien.

city.description: Lender City of current assigned lender for the open lien.

state.description: Lender State of current assigned lender for the open lien.

zipcode.description: Lender ZIP code of current assigned lender for the open lien.

EnrichedLienCurrentLender.description: Current open lien origination lender details.

unpaidPrincipalBalance.description: CoreLogic enriched estimated Unpaid Principal Balance (UPB) value on Purchase and Refinance loans only. The Enriched proprietary logic is designed to improve completeness and accuracy.

upbConfidenceRank.description: A rank of 1-5 depicting the confidence level of the Estimated Unpaid Principal Balance. 5 is the most confident ranking. Values: 5 = Excellent; 4 = Very Good; 3 = Good; 2 = Fair; 1 = Very Low

presentLTV.description: CoreLogic enriched estimated Loan to Value (LTV) at 'Present' date. This is a dynamic ratio, at time of calculation. The Enriched proprietary logic is designed to improve completeness and accuracy. Value expressed as a percentage.

presentLTVConfidenceRank.description: A rank of 1-5 depicting the confidence level of the Estimated Present Loan to Value. 5 is the most confident ranking. Values: 5 = Excellent; 4 = Very Good; 3 = Good; 2 = Fair; 1 = Very Low; 0 = UNK (Insufficient Information)

upbAndPLTVRunDate.description: Month, Day, Year that UPB and PLTV enriched calculations were run for loan. Purchase and Refinance loans are only loan types associated with Estimated UPB and Estimated PLTV. Format: YYYYMMDD

ltv.description: CoreLogic enriched estimated Loan to Value (LTV) of Primary Loan at loan origination. This is a static ratio. The Enriched proprietary logic is designed to improve completeness and accuracy. Value expressed as a percentage.

ltvConfidenceRank.description: A rank of 1-5 depicting the confidence level of the Estimated Present Loan to Value. 5 is the most confident ranking. Rank descriptions: 5 = Excellent; 4 = Very Good; 3 = Good; 2 = Fair; 1 = Very Low; 0 = UNK ( Insufficient Information)

companyCode.description: CoreLogic standardized lender code that identifies the mortgage lender (e.g., Bank of America = 000003).

companyName.description: CoreLogic proprietary and standardized name of lender.

fullName.description: Full name of Lender as recorded on the original document when no CoreLogic Lender Company Code exists.

lastName.description: Name of Lender's Last Name as recorded on the original document when Lender is a Private Party.

firstName.description: Name of Lender's First Name as recorded on the original document when Lender is a Private Party.

address.description: Address of the Lender as recorded on the original document.

city.description: Lender City as recorded on the original document.

state.description: Lender State as recorded on the original document.

zipcode.description: Lender ZIP code as recorded on the original document.

enrichedConforming.description: CoreLogic enriched value that indicates if the mortgage loan is considered a conforming loan.  The Enriched proprietary logic is designed to improve completeness and accuracy. Values:  0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

equity.description: CoreLogic standardized value that indicates if the mortgage loan is an equity loan. Values:  0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

enrichedFHA.description: CoreLogic standardized value that indicates if the mortgage loan is an FHA (Federal Housing Authority) loan. 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

construction.description: CoreLogic standardized value that indicates if this mortgage is specifically for any type of construction on the property and is identified as a construction loan on the trust documents. 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

privatePartyLender.description: CoreLogic standardized value that indicates if the mortgage loan lender is a private party or lender not currently listed in the CoreLogic Lender table. 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

sellerCarryBack.description: CoreLogic standardized value that indicates if part or all of the mortgage loan is carried by the seller. 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

plannedUnitDevelopmentRider.description: Indicates if a Planned Unit Development (PUD) Rider was recorded with the mortgage loan. 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

multifamilyRider.description: Indicates if a Multifamily Rider was recorded with the mortgage loan. 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

condominiumRider.description: Indicates if a Condominium Rider was recorded with the mortgage loan. 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

secondHomeRider.description: Indicates if a Second Home Rider was recorded with the mortgage loan. 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

eligibleMortgageGSE.description: Indicates if a Government Sponsored Enterprise Mortgage Rider was recorded with the mortgage loan. 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

variableRider.description: CoreLogic standardized value that indicates if the mortgage loan contains an adjustable or variable rate rider. 0 or null = not applicable, 1= applicable.

amount.description: The amount of the mortgage modification.

maturityDate.description: The date the mortgage modification becomes due. Format: YYYYMMDD.

interestRate.description: Interest rate on the mortgage modification.

mortgageCompositeTransactionId.description: Unique transaction key comprised of FIPS Code, Transaction Batch Date, Transaction Sequence Number, and Mortgage Sequence Number.

enrichedLTV.description: Ratio of origination loan amount divided into current AVM value.

multiOrSplitParcelCode.description: Corelogic standardized code that identifies which parcel is being referenced in a multiple or split parcel sale. Values: NULL = Not applicable, M = First APN involved in the transaction of a multiple parcel sale, D = Second or subsequent APN involved in the transaction of a multiple parcel sale, S = Only APN involved in the transaction of a single parcel split, X = First APN involved in the transaction of a single parcel split, Z = Second or subsequent APN involved in the transaction of a single parcel split

enrichedMortgageLienPosition.description: CoreLogic derived position or priority of the recorded property lien. A purchase mortgage loan is usually lien position one (1), with the highest outstanding mortgage amount and recorded first. All other junior liens are subordinate.

typeCode.description: CoreLogic standardized mortgage classification for principal mortgages ('P'urchase, 'R'efinance) or subordinate mortgages ('J'unior).

purposeCode.description: CoreLogic standardized value indicating the reason for the principal or subordinate mortgage.  Won't be populated on pending record.  Values:  A = Cash out first, B = Rate/Term reduction, C = Piggy-back on purchase, D = Standalone subordinate, E = First with subordinate, F = New first mortgage, K = Consolidation, L = Undetermined first mortgage, M = Undetermined standalone subordinate, N = Piggy-back on refinance, O = HUD reverse mortgage, P = First trust modification, Q = Junior trust modification, V = Reverse mortgage

subordinateTypeCode.description: CoreLogic code indicating the type of subordinate mortgage secured. (e.g., 'C'redit Line, 'E'quity, Ba'L'loon).  Won't be populated on pending record. Used with Mortgage Subordinate Type Code Description element.

subordinateTypeCodeDescription.description: CoreLogic standardized description indicating the type of subordinate mortgage secured. (e.g., 'C'redit Line, 'E'quity, Ba'L'loon). Won't be populated on pending record. Defines the code found in Mortgage Subordinate Type Code element.

amount.description: The amount of the mortgage at the time of the transaction.

enrichedLoanTypeCode.description:
CoreLogic enriched type of loan secured, identified 
Values:
CNV = Conventional
FHA = Federal Housing Administration
VA = Veterans Administration
PP = Private Party
SBA = Small Business Association
EMPTY/NULL = Unknown
The Enriched proprietary logic is designed to improve completeness and accuracy.

enrichedLoanTypeCodeConfidenceRank.description: A rank of 1-5 depicting the confidence level of the Mortgage Loan Type Code. 5 is the most confident ranking. Rank descriptions: 5 = Excellent; 4 = Very Good; 3 = Good; 2 = Fair; 1 = Very Low. NULL if value is not Enriched.

enrichedInterestRate.description: Fixed interest rate at mortgage origination derived from recorded loan documents or enriched through additional data sources and predictive machine learning models. Adjustable interest rate per the recorded loan documents for mortgage records. Example rates: 3.75 or 5.25

enrichedInterestRateConfidenceRank.description: A rank of 1-5 depicting the confidence level of the Mortgage Interest Rate. 5 is the most confident ranking. Rank descriptions: 5 = Excellent; 4 = Very Good; 3 = Good; 2 = Fair; 1 = Very Low. NULL if value is not Enriched.

enrichedInterestRateTypeCode.description: CoreLogic enriched value indicating the type of mortgage interest rate. The Enriched proprietary logic is designed to improve completeness and accuracy.  Values: NULL = Unknown, ADJ = Adjustable, BAL = Balloon, FIX = Fixed

enrichedInterestRateTypeCodeConfidenceRa.description: A rank of 1-5 depicting the confidence level of the Mortgage Interest Rate Type Code. 5 is the most confident ranking. Rank descriptions: 5 = Excellent; 4 = Very Good; 3 = Good; 2 = Fair; 1 = Very Low. NULL if value is not Enriched.

enrichedTerm.description: Specific term associated with mortgage. Examples: 10, 15, 25

enrichedTermConfidenceRank.description: A rank of 1-5 depicting the confidence level of the Mortgage Term. 5 is the most confident ranking. Rank descriptions: 5 = Excellent; 4 = Very Good; 3 = Good; 2 = Fair; 1 = Very Low. NULL if value is not Enriched.

enrichedTermCode.description: Code used to identify whether the number stored in MORTGAGE TERM is in days, months or years. Enriched data is represented by 'Y'EARS only.

enrichedTermCodeConfidenceRank.description: A rank of 1-5 depicting the confidence level of the Mortgage Term Code. 5 is the most confident ranking. Rank descriptions: 5 = Excellent; 4 = Very Good; 3 = Good; 2 = Fair; 1 = Very Low. NULL if value is not Enriched.

mortgageDate.description: Borrower's signature date on mortgage/deed of trust. This represents the date the borrower's obligation to the lender begins, i.e. loan open date. This date is the same or prior to the recording date. If the day and/or month is missing, CoreLogic populates these values with 00. Format: YYYYMMDD.

maturityDate.description: The date the mortgage becomes due. Format: YYYYMMDD.

recordingDate.description: The date the mortgage transaction was recorded at the county. Format: YYYYMMDD.

documentYear.description: CoreLogic derived date that indicates the year the document was recorded at the county recorder office. A unique transaction key exists by combining the Transacation FIPS Code, Mortgage Loan Recorded Year and the Mortgage Recorded Document Number elements. Format: YYYY

documentNumber.description: The document number used by some counties to record mortgage transactions.

documentBookNumber.description: The Book number used by some counties to catalog their mortgage recordings. (e.g., 001234)

documentPageNumber.description: The Page number used by some counties to catalog their mortgage recordings. (e.g., 001234)

purchaseRecordingDate.description: Date the most recent purchase of the property was recorded at the county. Format: YYYYMMDD.

purchaseAmount.description: Dollar amount of the most recent purchase of the property.

totalNumberOfOpenMortgageLiens.description: Total number of open mortgage liens against the property.

totalAmountOfOpenMortgageLiens.description: Sum total of origination amounts of open mortgage liens against the property.

purchaseCombinedLTV.description: Ratio of the sum amount of all open liens at time of purchase divided by the sale amount. Value expressed as a percentage.

estimatedEquity.description: Estimated difference between current AVM value and the sum of all open, original loan amounts, for all open liens.  Uses THVx for Risk Management AVM that provides high level of accuracy and hit rate combination for quality control, workflow, new portfolio evaluation, and other risk management uses.

estimatedCombinedLTV.description: Estimated ratio of the sum amount of all open liens at origination divided into the current AVM value. Uses THVx for AVM that provides highest hit rate for use cases. Value expressed as a percentage.

firstMortgageDate.description: Recording date of the earliest mortgage record available in the database for the County.

lastMortgageDate.description: Recording date of the most recent mortgage record available in the database for the County.

firstReleaseDate.description: Recording date of the first release of mortgage record available in the database for the County.

lastReleaseDate.description: Recording date of the most recent release of mortgage available in the database for the County.

standardizedCounty.description: CoreLogic standardized county name associated with the property address.

standardizedState.description: CoreLogic standardized two-letter state postal abbreviation. (e.g. CA, TX)

clip.description: Unique identification number assigned to each property.

buyerLastName.description: Last name of the owner at the time of transaction.

buyerFirstNameAndMiddleInitial.description: First name and middle initial of the owner at the time of transaction.

buyerFirstName.description: First name of the owner at the time of transaction.

buyerMiddleInitial.description: Middle initial of the owner at the time of transaction.

originalSolarRecordingDate.description: Recording Date of the Original Solar Contract transaction associated with this Release record and refers to prior associated transaction. Format = YYYYMMDD. Typically refers back to the Recording Date of the Solar Contract 'Lien' transaction.

originalSolarDocumentNumber.description: Document Number of the Original Solar Contract transaction associated with this Release record and refers to prior associated transaction. Format = YYYYMMDD. Typically refers back to the Document Number of the Solar Contract 'Lien' transaction.

ownerMailingHouseNumber.description: The digits found to the left of a street name, representing the house number for the mailing address.

ownerMailingHouseNumberSuffix.description: The characters found to the immediate right of a house number (e.g., 202B Jones Rd).

ownerMailingHouseNumber2.description: The second set of numbers in an address range.

ownerMailingDirection.description: This field represents the direction found to the left of the street name (e.g., 9340 N Dunhill Dr). AKA Directional Abbreviations, Pre-Directional.

ownerMailingStreetName.description: The name or number of the street of the mailing address.

ownerMailingMode.description: The Mode or Type of street found to the right of the street name (e.g., 9340 N Dunhill Dr). AKA Street Designators / Street Suffixes.

ownerMailingQuadrant.description: The quadrant is found to the right of Mailing Mode (e.g., 2040 NW 100 ST SW). AKA Post-Directional.

ownerMailingUnitNumber.description: The unit or suite number of the mailing address (e.g., 649 Lake Shore Dr #1400).

ownerMailingCity.description: The city associated with the mailing address.

ownerMailingState.description: The two-letter USPS postal abbreviation associated with the state / protectorates / commonwealth (e.g., CA, VI, PR).

ownerMailingZipCode.description: Code assigned by the USPS. This is populated by various source files and other proprietary and non-proprietary processes. Data may be the 5-digit zip or 9-digit Zip+4 (e.g., 00501 or 954630042).

ownerMailingCarrierRoute.description: This is the four digit code used by the local mail carrier to identify the delivery path.

ownerMailingStreetAddress.description: Full mail address (not including City/St/Zip) (e.g. 123 N Main St). This also contains unparsed foreign mailing address.

buyerMailingHouseNumber.description: The digits found to the left of a street name, representing the house number for the mailing address.

buyerMailingHouseNumberSuffix.description: The characters found to the immediate right of a house number (e.g., 202B Jones Rd).

buyerMailingHouseNumber2.description: The second set of numbers in an address range.

buyerMailingDirection.description: This field represents the direction found to the left of the street name (e.g., 9340 N Dunhill Dr). AKA Directional Abbreviations, Pre-Directional.

buyerMailingStreetName.description: The name or number of the street of the mailing address.

buyerMailingMode.description: The Mode or Type of street found to the right of the street name (e.g., 9340 N Dunhill Dr). AKA Street Designators / Street Suffixes.

buyerMailingQuadrant.description: The quadrant is found to the right of Mailing Mode (e.g., 2040 NW 100 ST SW). AKA Post-Directional.

buyerMailingUnitNumber.description: The unit or suite number of the mailing address (e.g., 649 Lake Shore Dr #1400).

buyerMailingCity.description: The city associated with the mailing address.

buyerMailingState.description: The two-letter USPS postal abbreviation associated with the state / protectorates / commonwealth (e.g., CA, VI, PR).

buyerMailingZipCode.description: Code assigned by the USPS. This is populated by various source files and other proprietary and non-proprietary processes. Data may be the 5-digit zip or 9-digit Zip+4 (e.g., 00501 or 954630042).

buyerMailingCarrierRoute.description: This is the four digit code used by the local mail carrier to identify the delivery path.

buyerMailingStreetAddress.description: Full mail address (not including City/St/Zip) (e.g. 123 N Main St).  This also contains unparsed foreign mailing address.

buyerMailingOptOutIndicator.description: A "Y" represents a record where buyer has contacted the DMA (i.e., Direct Marketing Association) and has asked not to be contacted by mail for solicitation.

sequenceNumber.description:
Buyer sequence number.
If there are multiple buyers, the sequenceNumber begins with 1 for the first buyer and increases by one for each additional property buyer.

buyerFullName.description: Full name of the owner at the time of transaction.

paceAuthorityFullName.description: This is the PACE Authority name e.g. "California Municipal Finance Authority" "Western Riverside Council of Governments".

paceProgramAdministrator.description: PACE Program Administrator. If no Administrator is indicated on the document, and Tax Bureau is indicated, the Tax Bureau will be used. If neither Administrator nor Tax Bureau is indicated, the Authority Name will be repeated.

paceLienFirstPaymentYear.description: First Payment Year of PACE Lien.  Format: YYYY

paceLienLastPaymentYear.description: Last Payment Year of PACE Lien.  Format: YYYY

paceLienAssessmentPaymentAmount.description: The contractual assessment payment amount of PACE Lien.

paceLienCostOfImprovements.description: PACE cost of improvements, also known as disbursement.

paceLienRecordingDate.description: The date the PACE transaction was recorded at the county.  Format: YYYYMMDD

paceLienDeedCategoryTypeCode.description: CoreLogic proprietary deed category type code that identifies the class of recorded legal document. "J" for Pace Liens and Modifications and "R" for Releases.

paceLienDocumentTypeCode.description: The type of PACE Document. Options are: PX = PACE Lien; PM = PACE Modification; PZ = PACE Release.

paceLienRecordedDocumentNumber.description: The Document Number of PACE Document used by some counties to catalog their recordings.

paceLienRecordedDocumentBookNumber.description: The Book Number of PACE Document used by some counties to catalog their recordings.

paceLienRecordedDocumentPageNumber.description: The Page Number of PACE Document used by some counties to catalog their recordings.

paceLienTotalAssessmentAmount.description: Total Contractual Assessment amount (cost + fees) which is found in the body of NOA (Notice of Assessment) of PACE Document.

paceLienAssessmentDate.description: Date of PACE Assessment, if indicated on the document. If not indicated, the signature date will be used. Format: YYYYMMDD

paceLienDueDate.description: Contractual Assessment Expiration Date of PACE Document. Format: YYYYMMDD

compositePaceLienTransactionId.description: Unique transaction key comprised of FIPS Code, Transaction Batch Date, Transaction Sequence Number, and Mortgage Sequence Number.

paceLienProgramProductCode.description: CoreLogic code(s) identifying the type of PACE lien improvement(s) being funded. If more than one improvement type is funded, the codes will be concatenated in the field.

paceLienProgramProductCodeDescription.description: PACE Lien Program Product Code Description

solarEnergyContractAsOfDate.description:
Date the solar lien contract commenced.
Format: YYYYMMDD

solarEnergyDocumentDate.description:
Date the solar lien was executed or if the document is a lien release, then it is date of the solar lien was released.
Format: YYYYMMDD

solarEnergyAgreementTerm.description: Contains term of contract in years. (Exp. 10, 15, 20 years)

solarEnergyTypeOfAgreement.description: Indicates whether the solar lien agreement is a lease. Values: L = Lease; Null/Blank = Not a lease

solarEnergyAgreementAsOfDate.description:
Date the solar lien was recorded or issued.
Format: YYYYMMDD

solarProducerCompanyName.description: Name of the solar lien lender/financer.

solarContractRecordingDate.description: The date the solar contract transaction was recorded.  Format: YYYYMMDD

solarContractRecordedDocumentNumber.description: Recorders document number, used by some counties to record transactions.

solarContractRecordedDocumentBookNumber.description: The Book number used by some counties to record transactions.

solarContractRecordedDocumentPageNumber.description: The Page number used by some counties to record transactions.

solarContractDeedCategoryTypeCode.description:
CoreLogic proprietary deed category type code that identifies the class of recorded legal document.
Values:
L = Liens
R = Releases of liens

solarContractDocumentTypeCodeDescription.description: Description of type of lien document recorded.

solarContractEstimatedAmount.description:
Dollar amount of the solar contract listed. Occasionally, the document does not include an amount.
Examples:
$4387.38 = 4387.38
$13,765.00 = 13765.00

solarContractTransactionFipsCode.description: Federal Information Processing Standards codes used nationally to numerically identify a specific county or political jurisdiction.

solarContractTransactionApn.description: Unique transaction key comprised of FIPS Code, Transaction Batch Date, Transaction Sequence Number, and either Mortgage Sequence Number if record reflects mortgage data content or '000' if record does not reflect mortgage data content.

solarContractMultiOrSplitParcelCode.description: Indicates either that the transaction involves multiple parcels, or the split of an existing parcel.

firstSolarContractDate.description: Recording date of the earliest Solar Contract record available in the database for the County.

lastSolarContractDate.description: Recording date of the most recent Solar Contract record available in the database for the County.

firstPaceLienDate.description: Recording date of the earliest PACE Lien record available in the database for the County.

lastPaceLienDate.description: Recording date of the most recent PACE LIEN record available in the database for the County.

standardizedCounty.description: CoreLogic standardized county name associated with the property address.

standardizedFipsCode.description: CoreLogic standardized Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) code that identifies the county and state. The first two characters identify the state, and the next three characters define the county.

standardizedState.description: CoreLogic standardized two-letter state postal abbreviation. (e.g. CA, TX)

clip.description: Corelogic unique identification number assigned to each property.

sequenceNumber.description:
Solar transaction sequence number.
If there are multiple transactions, the sequenceNumber begins with 1 for the first transaction and increases by one for each additional transaction.

ownerFirstName.description: First name of the taxpayer or company name on the solar contract. The value "RECORD" means the name is illegible or left blank.

ownerMiddleNameOrMiddleInitial.description: Middle initial or name of the owner on the solar contract.

ownerLastName.description: Last name of the owner on the solar contract.

ownerSuffix.description: Suffix of the owner on the solar contract.

requesterAddress.description: Address of the company or person requesting the solar lien recording.

requesterCity.description: City of the company or person requesting the solar lien recording.

requesterState.description: State of the company or person requesting the solar lien recording.

requesterZipCode.description: 5-digit ZIP Code of the company or person requesting the solar lien recording.

requesterFirstNameOrCompanyName.description: First name of the company or person requesting the solar lien recording.

requesterMiddleNameOrMiddleInitial.description: Middle name of the company or person requesting the solar lien recording.

requesterLastName.description: Last name of the company or person requesting the solar lien recording.

requesterSuffix.description: Suffix name of the person requesting the solar lien recording.

totalPages.description: The total number of pages corresponding to the recorded document.

outputType.description: Format of the return images. PDF or TIFF.

statusCode.description: Status code to classify response to request.

statusMsg.description: Status message corresponding to the status code.

images.description: A string corresponding with the recorded document image that can be converted to a PDF or TIFF depending on the output type selected.

items.description: A string corresponding with the recorded document image that can be converted to a PDF or TIFF depending on the output type selected.

capRate.description: Capitalization rate is the ratio between the net operating income (NOI) (e.g. expected annual income produced by the property) divided by its capital cost or value (e.g. the original price paid to buy the asset) or alternatively its current market value. Used by investors to estimate the return on an investment.

high.description: Prediction Interval - Upper Limit. Calculation is: Estimated rental value + (Forecast Standard Deviation * Estimated rental value of the property). Example: 2000 + (0.1 * 2000) = 2200

low.description: Prediction Interval - Lower Limit. Calculation is: Estimated rental value - (Forecast Standard Deviation * Estimated rental value of the property). Example: 2000 - (0.1 * 2000) = 1800

estimatedValue.description: Estimated rental value of the property.

forecastStandardDeviation.description: Estimated Rental Forecast Standard Deviation - (Actual Rental value will fall within +/- one FSD of the estimated rental value 68 percent of the time.)

clip.description: Unique identification number assigned to each property.

runDate.description: Date that the Rent Amount Model was run. This model is run on a periodic cycle. This date does not represent the date of fulfillment. Format: YYYY-MM-DD
